Summary: Our room was very nice, a deluxe suite with balcony and ocean view. We had all the accommodations needed for a week long stay, but sadly we were only there for one night. The price was very reasonable for what all we had, but it probably is more as you get into the summer months. There was a lot of inside parking and it was free. Very clean and quiet I highly recommend it.

Summary Heading: Great location and very large room - great for family of 5!
Summary: Excellent location across the street from the beach and our unit had very large rooms.  All the amenities of home were available.   The room was clean and the service was excellent.  It was perfect for a family of 5, which is hard to find!
Manager Response: We appreciate your positive feedback. It was a pleasure to host your stay in Capistrano Beach.

Summary: This was our first major vacation as a family. We felt right at home and there were tones of activities for our kids to enjoy. The swimming pools were great and even better the beach which is probably a minute walk from the condo.The gym, fun room for our kids, all utensils etc in our condo made our vacation memorable. Also you're minute away from Costco for groceries etc.Staff always available.

Summary Heading: NIce place. Beware of time share presentation, espeically Diamond owners.
Summary: The resort is not fancy, but it is very nice and functional. I appreciate having a full kitchen. Pool and hot tub were great (although one hot tub was out of order our entire stay.)  The highway out front is a bit noisy, but our bedrooom was in the back of the unit and we slept well. We even used the BBQ on the deck to cook steaks one night. We had a few questions about the recent aquisition of Diamond by Hilton, so we went to the timeshare presentation and ended up walking out, we were so upset. Hilton is bascially telling us that Diamond resorts are 2-star and they are trying to upgrade them and we will be hit with a large assessment if we don't pay more money to convert to Hilton timeshare ownership. This is fraudulent and misleading. They also could not tell us how our

Understand that you will get some PCH traffic and train noise but it was worth it for evening sunsets and the comfortable facilities.  The location was very convenient for local attractions such as SJC Mission and Dana Point Harbor and bluff trails.

The 2-bedroom room was crowded and outdated.  It was meant for 6 however, we had 4 adults and were very crowded.  The appliances were ok not great but there was NO working counter space in the kitchen!!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback as we strive to improve with each and every stay.

Summary: Good location across from Capistrano Beach so the ocean views are excellent. Be aware, to get to the beach you have to walk across a fairly steep bridge over the highway.  Some might consider the room decor dated, but that isn’t a priority for us. Our room was clean and suited us fine.  Covered parking is included. The pool area has a clear plexiglass fence to block wind.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for staying with us. We appreciate your feedback and hope to see you back soon!

Summary: This is not a posh resort; it is a great place to feel comfortable, easy access to Dana Point Harbor, see God's beauty in His landscape, living creations, and pleasant people.  We were able to enjoy Captain Dave's whale watching (very close by) on Saturday.  Superb!
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us! We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback and hope to see you back soon!

Summary: We traveled along the coast to celebrate my partners 50th birthday. We had stayed here before and we liked it the first time around so we decided to book again. When trying to check-in for whatever reason the front doors were locked and needed someone to let you in.  arriving to room we seemed to be in the area what kind of looks deserted. On entering the room seemed okay. the room definitely needs some TLC.  The sofa had like what seemed stains from the border to the cushion it happens right, the bathroom doors where dirty as well as all the bottom of the cupboards bases. The bathtub needs engineering to fix the cocking on the back area. Idk if they are remodeling or what but deluxe room was just okay... but that ocean view was beautiful..
Manager Response: Dear guest, thank you for sharing your feedback on your recent stay with us. Our front doors lock at 7pm for security purposes which you may then access with your room key. Unless there was an emergency, our team would have been at the front desk and open the door for you immediately with a warm welcome. We sincerely apologize that you felt you were placed in a deserted area of the resort as that was not our intention. Our occupancy has been low as it is off season in addition with lower travel due to the heavy rain lately which is why it may have been quiet during your stay. We also apologize for the condition of your room. We are pleased to let you know we will be going through welcome renovations in the next couple years. If you decide to visit again, please don't hesitate to reach out to us so we may do what we can to ensure your next visit is a better experience.

Summary: This property has not been maintained. for a long time. Give it two or three more years under present management and it well be ready to be condemned. We had not been there for five or six years, and it is apparent that all maintenance fees are going into managements pockets not into taking care of the properties.

My wife and I took a long weekend in Dana Point, we wanted a place that felt like a hotel but had some room to spread out. This place was exactly what we had in mind. If you are looking for the ultimate hotel experience, then this may not be the place for you. But if you want a clean place with lots to do that is comfortable and feels like home then this is a great place to stay.
Manager Response: Thank you so much for sharing your feedback. We are pleased to hear that we met your expectations for your weekend getaway. Hope to see you back soon!

Summary Heading: My stay at the Riviera Beach Resort
Summary: I have stayed here two other times with my family.  We like the area very much. You have pools, spas a fitness area, pool table and activities for children.  It is close to many attractions and you have the ocean right across the street.
Manager Response: Ms. Jenella, thank you so much for recently staying with us and taking the time to share your feedback. We are so happy to hear that you enjoy the resort and look forward to your next visit!

Summary: Although many dream of a White Christmas, you can't beat a Christmas by the beach with weather in the 70's at a very nice resort.  The Capistrano Beach/ Dana Point location was exceptional.  The room with a direct view of the sunset was inspiring.  The ability to ride bicycles for free was unexpected as was the warm spa, the restaurant discounts and as stated, the great weather.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback, Mr. Robert. We greatly appreciate you staying with us and are pleased to know that you enjoy the resort. We hope to see you back soon!

Summary: it was good. my grandma paid for it so I don't know how the price matched up to the quality but the room smelled a little bit like an old person but it was still nice and spacious. i don't know why it had two bathrooms for one bedroom. that felt unnecessary but I can't complain. the walk to the north pool was long and the outdoor rug smelled like cat pee. everything else was perfect. I enjoyed the experience.

We were in a suite style room with two bedrooms, two bathrooms, and a full kitchen surrounding the living area.  Very clean, with nice furniture.  The place was very clean, we saw a few old stains on the carpet and such but that did not bother us.  I am a light sleeper, but was never bothered by noise in the hallway.  We did not have a waterfront room but our little balcony had a few chairs and a nice gas grill.  The staff texted a few times each day to ask if we needed anything.  I requested more coffee and an extra blanket (even California is chilly in December!), and the items were brought to our door quickly.  Every staff person we had contact with was very friendly, respectful and accommodating.  The onsite little store is well stocked, and the on site activities were

Everything went like clockwork.  Everyone was very helpful and friendly.  Our balcony was right over the Pacific Coast Highway but it was never noisy in the room.  Cute little gift shop with a reasonable selection of food and wine.  Parking was easy.  My wife didn’t like the bed much but I thought it was okay.  Lots of restaurants close by and the concierge was helpful with reservations.

Friendly staff, decent accommodations, great location, but they charge a resort fee which will likely lead to me never staying at this resort again.  Perhaps it is because Hilton took over the resort and I have never been much of a fan of the Hilton brand.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay halfway between LA and San Diego
Summary: We thoroughly enjoyed our second stay in the last 5 years at Riviera Beach Resort.  We didn't use the resort amenities because we mainly used it as a base for day trips to LA and San Diego.  We enjoyed the ocean view during sunsets, walks into Dana Point, the antique mall at San Juan Capistrano and dinner at Ruby's Auto Diner with its vintage cars. The room was very clean, comfortable and well-furnished. Since the resort fronts on a 4-lane highway and railroad, you'll probably hear some traffic and train noise at night, but that didn't wake us up.

Everything is in good shape and clean.  Staff was excellent and met our questions and needs with great attitudes and prompt assistance.  Kitchen had all that we needed.  The pool and spa temps were perfect.

The accomadations were clean and comfortable and the view was spectacular! I cant wait to come again with my family.  There's a bbq on the patio and the pool and hottub are close by. They even have bikes you can rent to ride on the beach!

Summary Heading: Wall facing balcony - odd number rooms- Phase 2 Bldg
Summary: Ivan at check-in, Miguel Ruvalcaba-Romero and Elizabeth Santiago did not resolve the issue of requested room (ocean view or whatever, other than the wall view) at all, regardless of plea for my own health concerns (the room made me feel very claustrophobic and was dark/ very depressing). The "second" bedroom had an accordion door that doesn't stay open nor shut. The tub jet was non-operational while the shower had very low water pressure, one bath sink made a gurgling noise while faucet is shut, called maintenance for clothes iron replacement and bbq grill wasn't all functioning, elevator was non- operational at check-in. This was our first vacation/"relaxation" for 2022. I have knee problems, so walking is an issue, that's why staying in the room could have been really

Room was pleasant. Windows need to be replaced as road noise is bad at night.  Trash truck came at 7:30 am and one day at 6:30 am.  Our room 228 was right over the parking garage. Pool was nice and jacuzzi needed some cleaning of tiles and defoamer.  Bikes are great to ride to beach or to eat at the Harmor. The game room nice and they also had ping pong and pool. View of ocean is the reason we stay there.

The resort was great.  Big clean rooms. Accommodating and friendly staff.  Complimentary bikes, beach chairs, beach umbrellas.  Safe location.  Not the most picturesque spot but very nice indeed.  Nearby beaches like Salt Creek Beach were outstanding.

Riviera Beach resort is the best resort in dana point, are check in was smooth. First building close to gym, actives center, bike rental free, hot tube great, pool lounge area , downstairs kids' area great. they thought of everything, dishes, bbg grill on patio. ocean view prefect.

This is not the newest resort, but it is quite comfortable.  It is one of the few resorts where you may prefer a studio. I believe 2 bedrooms are on the back side (no view), one bedrooms have an ocean view but the bedroom is behind (no view).  The employees in the Activities Center are wonderful, especialy Dagmire and Ellen.  And bikes can be checked out to cruise the area.

While the resort is older, it is under renovation.  But don't worry about issues because the beach views are terrific.  Can't get closer to the sand unless you are on the beach.  And the availability of beach supplies such as chairs, umbrellas, coolers, and even beach toys for the kids makes it a great option.

Summary Heading: 2bd unit with no ocean view but worst a wall view in the balcony
Summary: I was told pre-checking that customers that exchange their resort unit don’t get ocean view. I experience a week in a dark room with no air flow and was asked to check everyday if there is a cancellation. I did without success

We had a wonderful time in Capistrano. We had a beautiful view of the beach which brought back so many memories from my youth when I lived in Orange County and used to go to the beach regularly. It kind of saddened me that the beautiful coastline that I remember is now cluttered with so many manmade structures now but I guess that's progress.  My daughter in law and grandson had an absolute blast though since it was their first visit to the beach. We were also able to go out on a boat and see the dolphins frolicking in the ocean, no whales though. Over all it was an awesome stay.

Summary Heading: Poor stay would not come back!
Summary: Hotel was old and in need of refurbishing.  The carpets were old and musty, the drains were clogged in the bathrooms and the check in and check out was full of bad attitude.  The only nice person was in the lobby trying to sell us what seemed like time share on our check in....

Summary Heading: Riviera Beach Resort is convenient location to Dana Point
Summary: Riviera Beach Resort is close to the restaurants, shopping, and departure to Catalina Island in Dana Point.  Great beaches are nearby along with hiking trails.  The location is reasonable driving distance to San Juan Capistrano and San Diego.  We took a short drive North to the Ritz Carlton and parked for a reasonable price where we caught the Laguna Beach Trolley (free) to the Pageant of the Masters show.  Quick and easy with no parking headaches.

The property is very clean, and the rooms are very comfortable. The excellent customer service is what made my wife & I stay so great. The availability of the BBQ on the balcony overlooking the Ocean really makes for a very comfortable stay.

Disappointing. Great location across from Doheny State Beach. The facility unfortunately is not well maintained. Staff seems to be overtaxed and maid service is only offered before and after a stay. May things are either broken or worn out.

Booked a room for my family for the Ohana Encore Festival.  The Festival was cancelled and the property refused to give me a refund.  I wasted $753 on absolutely nothing.  I booked through a 3rd party and neither Agoda nor the Rivera Beach resort will give me the time of day.    Very uncooperative....

Beautiful room with extraordinary views of Doheny Beach and Dana Point.  We enjoy the wide variety of Brew Houses and fine restaurants within a short distance of resort, and access to bike trail to San Clemente Pier.

Summary Heading: Need improvement as a HILTON properties
Summary: The shower!!  Feels like in 2 stars hotel/motel. I thought i stayed in HILTON???   Bathtub has hard water stains caused by the bathmat in your bathtub.  Toilet was short and small!! Like a kid's toilet!  Kitchen cabinet peeling. Worn out?  Microwave door painted over, cheap way!?  Sofa bed was dirty. Blood stained on mattress cover.  The water in big swimming pool cloudy possibly over chlorinated. I called front desk but no one showed up to check on our complaint! Hello????

This place has beautiful views as long as you get ocean view room and don’t mind trains and cars in front of you. Toilets are made for 3 year olds because they are so low to the ground. Other guests slam their doors and drag furniture. Security is a joke I had my car run into my last stay and there were 2 cameras and they still couldn’t find footage , I even gave exact time my car was hit from Mercedes app. Then when I call they said that there insurance was going to handle it. (Lol) Miguel gave me wrong number and they didn’t do anything about it. Overall this is a nice place besides the nasty dirty carpets that have never been steam cleaned. I spilled a little water so I went to dry it up and the towel came up black,glad I wear sandals

The hotel and location were excellent, as were the amenities.  The children loved the craft days, the pool and the movie night!  They loved the game room as well but would have been nice if all the games worked or were replaced with working ones.  The rooms were so clean and spacious.  We always stay at Diamond Resort properties and this one did not disappoint in the room!  The washers were broken and it was disappointing that in 4 days they couldn't get them fixed, so that was a bummer.  The receptionist on Tuesday 08/02 that was there around4:45pm was not friendly or helpful.  Other than those 2 things, everything was amazing and excellent!  We absolutely loved our stay and the parking was convenient and safe!  Thank you for another great stay!

Beautiful location, beautiful resort, will definitely stay here again! The staff was super friendly and very helpful. Beautiful beach and nearby beaches. Great restaurants. Especially loved the trolley!

I love getting a 1 bedroom unit with ocean view.  It is so calming to sit on the balcony and read a book as the surf crashes on the shore across the street  Be aware, you do have to cross PCH and take pedestrian walkway across RR tracks to get to the beach.  Train passes often, but is not noisy.

Beautiful location. Walked to the beach. My kids enjoyed the beach nearby. They were excited about renting the bicycle. They loved playing in the fun zone game room of the resort. Staff was very helpful.

From the moment we arrived (7/19/22), staff welcomed us. We had a two bedroom ocean view room. When our grandson needed batteries for his new truck, Miguel sent someone right up to supply us!  The facility set up a text message system, where all I had to do to request anything was to text and housekeeping brought it right up.  Also, our room was spotless as that is usually a pet peeve of mine.  The only thing I would say is to update the bathroom, as the toilet and shower pressure needs to be addressed.  Otherwise, thank you all so much for making the stay for myself, my husband and our two grandsons (who loved the pool and spa) wonderful.  When you close your patio door, you do not hear the train noise at all.  Loved the crashing of the waves.

Somewhat disappointed in the state of the room when we checked in. Housekeeping successfully cleaned the chairs however the odor of the room never went away. Check in and check out was easy.  Overall property was in good shape. Renovations to the owners lounge so we could not enjoy that.

We always enjoy our stay in the resort coz of its proximity to the beach, I just wished we were given a 2-bath one bedroom accommodation during our stay…I requested it repeatedly from the time I checked in at the front offc, clerk did not say anything so I thought I would be getting one, but found out the unit is not what I requested, I called the front offc to request to be transferred, but was told can’t do it. I thought when we did upgrade and became  SILVER member after paying thousands of $$$, that we would be able to get unit that we request/prefer for more satisfying stay.

I have been going to this timeshare for years.  Since it has been sold from Diamond to Hilton it's not getting any better.  Timeshares need to remember they are their for families and take inconsideration peoples request and/or needs.

Summary Heading: Bathrooms have been beautifully updated--now for everything else!
Summary: The resort is across the street from the Pacific Ocean and has views of Doheny State Beach. The rooms are large but need new furniture and most everything updated. Like our title says: the bathrooms have been wonderfully updated, but nothing else is past a 6 out of 10. Most all of the carpeting needs to go and be replaced by tile. The beds are okay but the pillows all smell terrible and need to be changed much more often. Full kitchen & full-size refrigerator and freezer, however there is no oven just a microwave! There is a large, wonderful gas barbecue on most of the patios. Our room was number 420 and it was on the top floor & ocean-side. The resort is situated right on Pacific Coast Highway and also the train tracks . If noise bothers you, this is not the right location for

Everything was as what we expected.  It was busy but that was to be expected since it was a major holiday week.  The only thing I would like to see improved was the dishes in the kitchen.  Only minimum plates, glasses and silverware which meant we had to continually wash them after every meal or bring all disposable items. And some serving bowls and additional cooking pans would greatly appreciated.

We had a great stay at the resort with our 4 kids.  Great pool/hot tub area.  Close to the beach though access is a little tough with a stroller as you have to carry kids/stroller up 54 steps and down 54 steps across the train tracks.  The staff was awesome.  We checked out movies, umbrella, beach chairs/towels, and sand toys that were complimentary.  Free laundry on site was helpful after a week on the road with young family.  Our view was not great as the east facing rooms look straight into a wall/hill.  Big spacious rooms and kitchen were great.  We'd come back for sure!

Requested ocean view - didn't receive it Entered room and BBQ gas and burner were left on construction in the suite next door during our entire visit 5am fire alarm due to someone in the office making pop corn our room was constantly shaking as if there was an earthquake.  Come to find out we were above the laundry room.

Great location, good sized rooms. Easy access to bus/trolley stops. We rode trolleys all the way from San Clemente to Laguna Beach. Dans Point Harbor area is great for walking nice restaurants and shops.

This place was average.  It can be pretty nice IF you get a room with a view of the ocean.  I have stayed here several times before and have enjoyed my stay and always had a view. This time being a timeshare exchanger, they gave me and several other exchangers the 2 bedroom rooms that are located on the backside of this building.  It's horrible.  Hot, smelly, dark, and, they do not have good ventilation as one door opens to an enclosed hallway and the balcony opens to the wall with about a 3-4 ft gap but too high to circulate any air.  Only one washing machine was working.  The maid at the pool cleaned the toilets from the bottom up including the handle.  Beware, if you're an exchanger your name needs to be on the contract or they won't let you check in.  I'm co-owner and they

This location is great. It is across the street from the beach! It is an hour away from San Diego and 30 minutes away from Disneyland and hour away from Los Angeles. I was able to book rooms for my two other siblings and they loved the location. The check in process was easy. The staff were great and friendly. If we needed anything and called the front desk they were tentative and provided what we needed quickly! The rooms were great and clean. The bathroom was nice and big. We had a room looking over the ocean which was great! The kitchen area was great and did alot of cooking! The pool and hot tubs where great for our kids!  They loved it. I would recommended Rivera Beach Resort!

Love the resort location directly across the street from the beach and ALL the amenities they offer like free bike rentals, free beach chairs, umbrellas, coolers, sand toys... awesome that we didn't have to pack any of that stuff!  We could also borrow games like monopoly, scrabble, cards, etc.

Summary Heading: Well Maintained! Excellent Location!  Great Customer Service!!
Summary: We have stayed here several times.  This last weekend I was in a bit of a rush to leave.  As we were almost home on the freeway the resort called, I left my tablet in the room.  They immediately packed and sent it to me!   Thank YOU!!

This is a very nice place to stay with a great location and nice views.  The beach closest to the property is quite rocky but we still had a wonderful vacation.  Two hot tubs were nice and they had lots of bicycles to use.

Summary Heading: Nice place, avoid the timeshare people
Summary: We have been coming here every summer for over 20 years.  We saw it slide and then reverse the slide.  Great improvements.  Timeshare people are still pushy.  Lied to us the only time we interacted with them.

The resort seems a little run down Many problems with internet and electricity. 4 text messages upon return home. No printed statement upon check out.  Happy with the size of the room, the view and assistance from housekeeping

close to beach, Dana Point and many local attractions. Staff were nice accommodating. Resort try's to have items available to not have to leave. Pool was very nice and other guests were respectful of each other.

Summary Heading: Great place for a family trip!
Summary: Spacious rooms, everything we needed in the kitchen, a great pool area, and a central location to all of our planned outings made for a really great trip with the grand kids. Would definitely stay again.

We always enjoy our visits to Riviera Beach. Our room was very well detailed. Shopping and restaurants are very close by. We took in a movie at the Metroplex which was just minutes away in San Clemente.  Weather was not the best, but enjoyed our stay all the same.

MGV need more knowledgeable people who’s aware of owners rights-to-use facilities. Reservationist even said my sons cannot use it if I wasn’t present. My husband and I were both registered owners and has never encountered this type of problem at any MGV/Hilton properties before.

This was an OK place to stay, the main pool still being worked on, the in-room spa tubs are not operational, the room barbecue not working 100% as one burner would not light and the pool table in the activity room was warped and cloth torn, needs to be replaced.

The resort was located very conveniently to John Wayne airport and within an hour of San Diego where we spent a lot of time with family. However, it was close enough to visit family in Ventura County as well. The rooms were spacious, not overly luxurious, but comfortable, and the ocean view was awesome. The only problem was that if you had the door open, the traffic on Highway 1 was extremely loud, but with the door closed (well insulated) you could not hear the traffic at all, but you could also not hear the ocean. Overall, we enjoyed our time and plan to return.

Summary Heading: Don't Stay Here if you have special needs!
Summary: Phase 1 of complex offers NO handicap showering!  Tub higher than floor not able to get in and out safely. No walk-in showers only tubs even in 2 bedroom units.  If you have knee or hip or balance issues beware!  Where to sit also an issue, chairs in living area have broken springs and you sink so low you can't get back out!  Also they seem to be patching and painting to fix things.  Bottom of door in bathroom warped, cabinet in kitchen sanding bad and repainted, same old heavy awkward furniture in unit.  Too much bulky stuff no room to even move around.  Needs a facelift!  Thank god the elevator was working this time otherwise I could not have stayed at all!!  So disappointing.

Very friendly staff, clean room and amenities.  Enjoy using the resort's bicycle to ride along the ocean.  Close to Dana Point Harbor great restaurants and shopping.  Dana Point a very clean town the cliff were beautiful.

This is a great location and resort! Friendly staff  and centrally located to restaurants and shops. We would definitely stay here again if we visit Legoland or Disneyland with the grandkids. Clean rooms, great view of the ocean.

Stayed In a 2 room suite. Outdated, other than the kitchen. Patio looks into a plastic tarp with in a few feet. No signal for cell phone. Elevator slow, carpets not vacuum. There was dog poop in the living room. Master bathroom has a tub that is so massive you have to stand in the middle to take a shower. Slipping hazard. Light bulbs burnt out. I would suggest finding another hotel. The price is not worth it.

the ocean view room has an excellent view of the beach and ocean.  easy access to shops & food places.  we enjoyed the outlets at san clemente & visiting san juan capistrano historical was very memorable.  on site parking & friendly staff.

Summary Heading: This is an "average" place to stay
Summary: It was our first time staying at Riviera Beach Resort and we had an okay experience.  It was well located, near freeways and walking distance to beach.  We had a view of the ocean, which was nice, but Hwy 1 was between the building and the beach, so the traffic noise was loud at times--mostly when we were outside at the pool.  Inside it was okay as long as the windows were closed.  The bedroom is away from the street, so was quiet. We had two units for our family and they were in different buildings, so we had to walk a lot to get together.  The hallways felt long and stark after 6 days/nights.

Summary Heading: Nice resort with awesome ocean views
Summary: This resort has awesome ocean views and has plenty of fun center and games for the kids.  The rooms and kitchen are clean and comfy.   We enjoyed our stay and will come back in the near future.   The room interiors can have an upgrade to a higher standard, especially the bathrooms.   Other than that, it's a great resort for family trips.

Summary Heading: Phenomenal place - but traffic noise a damper!
Summary: This would be one of those placers that I would take my entire family!  Very well set up for large groups!  However, it's on Highway 1 PCH and very noisy to leave the slider open - and to get to the bike trail, was a hurdle.  They could do so much if these three hotels pitched in and worked together.  Don't get me wrong, they are doing an outstanding job with what they are dealt with the train and traffic.  Price a bit high for the location and could take some of that profit to figure out a solution to easier access to beach or glass sound barrier.

My first ever time on the west coast, and I would do it again! Amazing resort, employees and other owners were nice and respectful. Amazing location and so much to do around the resort, definitely recommend!

Great place to visit, clean room, neat appliances working order, great staff at front office even the sales team very nice. Overall everything really happy with the bathroom and a great view of the Ocean.

Visiting our grandchildren and once again Diamond made the stay special with all the activities and beach toys. they kids played until the sun was down and once back in the room the settled in for the night.

Summary Heading: LIterally Across the STREET, but nice....
Summary: This is a nice place to say, the views are great, but it is literally across the street from the ocean.  So you have the constant noise of cars and oh, then of course the train.  Yup, its the resort, PCH, AmTrak tracks south, a parking lot THEN the beach.  Other than that, the views are nice and the place is clean and the location cannot be changed, so if you tune it out, or just car watch which can be cool in this part of town...its nice.  Staff all get a 10!!

Aging but clean and comfortable venue for enjoyment of Laguna, Dana Point, San Clemente, Catalina Island etc. Super sunset views. Good nearby walking, cycling, and beach opportunities. Ample pool and dual hot-tubs plus good sunbathing space. Variety of nearby dining options. Fading upholstery on dining room chairs the only shortcoming of furnishings..

My rating for this facility should be 2.5 stars, what really struck me was that This Property was actually a Diamond Resort?  At first glance this facility looked promising, but on check in we were concerned by the long narrow hallways which echoed noises into our unit.  The unit itself was small and a bit claustrophobic.  It had a very small bedroom with a queen sized bed.  The unit was tired and in need of a remodel, there was no privacy on the deck, our neighbors were so close we overheard their conversations well into the evening.  What caused us to check out early was the noise level.  We were awakened several times during the night by slamming doors and loud voices in the hallway.  An issue that management could not resolve, it was a construct of the manner in which the

Summary Heading: Great view of the ocean from a compact, easily accessible unit.
Summary: Check in was a bit early and very efficiently handled by the friendly staff.  Our unit, #324 on the top floor, phase one at the north end of the building.  The unit is near the elevator and stairs making access to the garage and laundry room convenient.  The unit was high enough to have a great view of the ocean and a lesser impact of the trains and traffic.  Being on the end meant our two bedroom unit was somewhat compact but having only three people staying, we managed with little difficulty.  The staff was helpful to responded quickly to requests for additional recycling bags and trash pickup. Our unit was clean and everything functional during our visit.He location is close to Dana Point Harbor and several good dining spots plus within easy walking distance to restaurants

We are in a one bedroom, ocean view room that has been spectacular respecting the view. We have slept soundly with the two clean waves crashing against the seashore. The balcony is a treat to sit and drink a glass of some good red wine, as my wife and I have caught up on life and renewed our love together.
Manager Response: We are overjoyed to know you thoroughly enjoyed your visit. Thank you for sharing these lovely comments with us. We hope to see you both again soon! –HN

Summary: We decided to stay here because we enjoy ocean views.  The facility was very clean and well maintained.  We were pleased with the available parking and the amenities that were offered by the resort.  We will come back here in the future for a longer stay so we can explore more of the area.
Manager Response: The biggest compliment we can receive is a guest who wants to return! Thank you for sharing your feedback and for choosing to spend your hard-earned vacation at Riviera Beach Resort. -HN

Summary: The resort is in a great location. Free trolly ride to all surrounding areas with plenty of activities.  The room itself needs updating badly.  Very outdated and bathrooms are worn out and unable to clean properly. Kitchen is great!! Fully stocked with everything to cook and clean for meal prep.  Staff are all helpful and friendly.  Pool areas are very nice and the other patrons are all nice and looking for a good time.  Nice crowd!
Manager Response: We are glad we were able to provide you a great experience at our resort. We hope to see you again with us! - MP

Summary Heading: Relax to the sound of the surf.
Summary: If you get an ocean facing unit you will be able to enjoy the sound and views of the surf.   Our unit #327 was well furnished and included a separate bedroom/vanity sink, one full bathroom, and well appointed kitchen.  Beach is across the street, so you have to walk a bit and cross over the railroad tracks on the elevated pedestrian bridge to the beach.  The pools are nice and a family game room is available with a pool table, ping pong, etc.  We are Diamond members.
Manager Response: We’re so glad to hear that you enjoyed our resort and its amenities. Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts with us. We hope to welcome you back very soon! -HN

Summary Heading: Capistrano Beach location on the PCH.  Ocean front location is on the PCH, busy traffic, loud.  Beautiful view, pool
Summary: Beautiful, clean ocean front first floor room.  Loud from traffic.  Higher floors are quieter.  Pool, family area and ping pong areas are always very nice and clean.    Very disappointed to have had a small barking dog in the room next to us.   As a disabled person and a service dog owner, this is very frustrating.  This was clearly a family pet along for personal comfort.  Barking at people walking by and traffic.   I see this all the time.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback. We will share your comments with our team and hope you had a pleasant visit overall. -HN

Summary: We sent three nights at this location and enjoyed every minute of it. The room was ready and was very clean when we checked in. We stayed on the third floor /one bedroom condo. The pools and grounds were well maintained. It was nice to have an onsite store and activity center where we rented bikes for a couple of hours. We took advantage of the local bike path and enjoyed lunch at the Dana Point Marina. The traffic noise can be a little much at times. We will be returning.
Manager Response: We're so glad to know you thoroughly enjoyed your time with us. We are looking forward to having you back to enjoy all of the activities we have to offer! -HN

Summary Heading: Good location for a beach trip
Summary: We stayed at Riviera Beach as part of my Diamond Resort membership.  We stayed in room 234, which faced the beach but was over the smaller pool and could be noisy.  Some rooms do not face the beach so ask before you book.  The condo had 1 bedroom with a king bed and a pull-out couch, which was very comfortable.  The unit was very clean and recently updated.  Parking was free and there was no resort fee, which makes sense since this isn't a resort in the typical sense, it was a hotel/condo.  They do offer free use of beach items including chairs, umbrellas and coolers.  They have bikes, we didn't use them so I do not know if there was a fee.  There was a full size fridge which allowed us to have breakfast and prep lunch each day.  We ate dinner out.  There is also free laundry.
Manager Response: We are delighted to know you had an overall pleasant stay and are planning to return, Pat! Thanks for taking the time to leave a review for our resort - we can't wait to welcome you back. -HN

Summary Heading: Well maintained older facility with great view and delightful accommodations.
Summary: Only suggestion to improve: perhaps when the time to replace toilets - a higher "comfort" one would be helpful to older guests, or else install a grab bar by the commode (like the one in the shower).  No need for full handicap accessible.
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback and suggestion. We hope you enjoyed your visit overall and we'd love to host your stay again in the future. -HN

Summary Heading: A Place We Enjoy (for the most part)
Summary: We actually enjoy this location however some may find the traffic/train noise during the day annoying. The ocean view rooms are nice (except the beds are very hard and not very comfortable), have a nice kitchen, and there is lots to do in the area. It is part of a timeshare with Diamond Resorts that does not have a very good reputation. Once checked in (saying “no” 15x to sit thru their presentation) , unplug the phone and enjoy your stay.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback you shared with us, we appreciate it! - MP

Summary: Rooms are always immaculate. Helpful friendly staff, fantastic location.  Been coming her 26 years, each time there is something new to do or go. Best beach get away in California. World renowned dolphin and whale watching. Finest restaurants anywhere on the coast. Wonderful stay for a family, couples, or solo, I have done them all.
Manager Response: Thank you for your positive feedback and we are glad that you are always having a great experience at our resort. We look forward to seeing you again! - MP

Summary: Public areas and rooms have been renovated.  The hotel staff was cordial, receptive and helpful.  Fitness room was equipped with new Star Trac equipments.  Kitchen was equipped and even a barbecue grill was provided on our balcony.  The small drawbacks were that there was only 1 public elevator, the room walls lacked modern acoustics, and the stairwell was not well marked. Overall, our stay was very good.  They even check out courtesy bicycles for their guests.
Manager Response: We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay with us! Thank you for sharing your experience and feedback, and we hope to welcome you back soon. -RW

Summary: Fun days with foods of choice .Weather the best. Good friends enjoying outdoors. Safe and clean environment. We visited the antique shops,walked the beaches ,found new friends, enjoyed our comfortable and clean rooms.Staff always helpful.
Manager Response: It sounds like you had a lovely visit with us, and we're so glad to hear it! Thank you for this kind review, and come back to visit any time. -RW

Summary Heading: Awesome staff, clean room, Relaxation, Convenient, Rejuvinating, Fun,  Beach front view available.
Summary: My #1 ocean beach front  view resort here at Capistrano Beach by Diamond  Have been returning and staying at Riviera Beach Shores at least 3 x yearly solo or w/ friends. Awesome ocean beach view (Doheney Beach) Very Relaxing, stress  free parking,  walking, jogging, or biking (bikes avaialble).  Doheny beach walking distance. Read on the beach across w/picnic tables along the beach or bring your own chair. Great for family w/kids, couples, or solo traveller. Great Wifi to catch up on chart notes, email, continuing education,or keep up w/ business. Less stress than travelling to Hawwaii. Ocean view room w/  BBQ grill on own Balcony clean and convenient. Costco, Albertson,  Chart house restaurant, Dana point harbor and etc all 5 min away. Clean full equipped kitchen w/dishwasher,
Manager Response: We appreciate your continued support and visits to our property, Daphne! It is always a pleasure to have you, we look forward to bringing you more stress-free vacations. -HN

Summary: Right on pacific coast hwy across the street from the Pacific Ocean. The room is very roomy and clean. It’s a deluxe studio. Full kitchen, dining area and living area. The only problem is the noise of the traffic and occasional Coaster train.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know you had a great stay with us. We hope you will come back and visit us again soon! -GP

Summary: Immaculate room, every amenity necessary, Many grocery stores near by, wonderful guest service, one of a kind view of Capistrano Beach, Doheny Beach, and Dana Harbor, unbelievable sunsets. Plenty to do, restaurants, Dana Harbor shopping,  Capistrano mission is just up the road.  Beach is literally right across the street, Surfing, Fishing, Whale watching, daily trips to Catalina Island. Bikes and other services available.  Great stay for a couple or the whole family. Two pools to choose from, plus an exercise room.  Safe, secure underground parking. Close to other beach cities, San Clemente, easy drive to San Diego. Will come back again as soon as I can.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know you had a great stay with us. We hope you will come back and visit us again soon! -GP

Summary: Went here last week for a getaway during COVID.  It was awesome!  I havent stayed here in years and I was kindly surprised.  The room was very clean and nicely updated.  We had a ocean view room and it was lovely.  The staff was great and they enforced the social distancing rules which was great.  Pools stay open until 11:00pm and we enjoyed them pretty much to ourselves in the evenings.   Resort offers free bike rentals and beach chairs and umbrellas. I really enjoyed my getaway during these crazy times.  Will definitely be returning.
Manager Response: Thank you for letting us know you had a great stay with us. We hope you will come back and visit us again soon! -GP

Summary: Great location, renovated unit, great staff. Icean right across the road, we had 2 bedroom oceanview unit. Too bad jacuzzis are closed due to Covid-19. Some resorts in CA have kept their jacuzzis open.
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review. Come back soon, please. 🙂 -GP

Summary: The elevator is out and being on the third floor is a lot of steps ! Also with Covid they do not do mid week cleanings you have to go to the front desk to get any items but great views and location the beach is close hear the waves! Try the Strands beach in Dana point or the pier in San Clemente!
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. -GP

Summary: Our room was spotless when we checked in and we love the protocols they have in place to keep us safe while we are on vacation.  Steps from the beach and an incredible restaurant Olamendi's right next door!
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your review. We're delighted to hear you enjoyed your stay. -GP

Summary Heading: Old, Outdated, in Desperate Need Help
Summary: Decided to take the extended family to the beach for a fun getaway.  We timeshare traded into this location as it was listed as a Diamond Property and we had a good experience at their Maui property a few years ago. This property has a great location and that is the only good thing I can say about it!  I knew when we pulled in this was going to not be a good stay. The exterior was worn and needed repair. When we got inside the room, it looked like their had not been updated for 7+ years. The master bath had a spa tub from two that was clearly from the 80’s (something you’d see in a bad porn) that had been broken so long it had an engraved plaque stating do not use - broken. I would never consider staying there again and neither should you. Diamond you should be ashamed to put
Manager Response: We appreciate your feedback, thank you. -GP

Summary: Booked a ocean view room through Hotels.com, arrived at  "resort" and was told their system was down and that the room I had booked was not in the building with an ocean view.  Asked for an ocean view and was charged an additional $50.00 for room type upgrade.  Had to complete a pre-paid room authorization so they could charge my card the additional, plus $33.00 in a "resort" fee, which is more that what was quoted on website. Room was an ocean view, as well as a street view, and a train view.  No where on the website did it say your view would be obstructed by a train, and that you would also hear it going by during the night.  Not at all what I expected for the price.

Summary Heading: Beach Resort Lost In The Stone Age
Summary: Me and my gf booked this hotel for a reasonable price off the hotels website. After I did some research we thought it would be a good idea to call the hotel to make sure we had a room with a beach view because why get a room on the beach without a view of the beach right? Well when we called we talked to the front desk, they couldn't give us any information on our reservation so they transferred us to reservations which told us we didn't have a room with a view instead we were at the back of the building. So we asked why isn't a option on the website to get a beach view and she said she didn't know why it wasn't on the website. So we asked to speak to a manager, the manager got on and we told him our situation and he also stated he didn't know why it wasn't on the website and
Manager Response: Thank you for your constructive feedback, Aaron. We appreciate it and will be keeping it in mind as we continue to work on improvements. It's great to hear we were able to address your concerns. -GP

Summary: We have stayed at the Riviera Beach resort several times so we know pretty much what to expect. The resort is across the street from the beach and a busy railroad so there is a lot of noise. Not really a peaceful place but it is centrally located in Orange County which is good for us. It's a bit run down even though they have made many changes since Diamond Resorts bought it several years ago. The lounge chairs by the pool now have nice cushions. The room we were in had some upgrades.The kitchen appliances and bathtub showed significant wear and tear but were completely functional.
Manager Response: Thank you for your constructive feedback, we will keep your comments in mind as we work on improvements. -GP

Summary: If you are thinking of staying here, think again. the WORST place we stayed at in months of travelling. Front desk staff were snooty and rude, aside from one which I believe was the manager. Resort fee of 20.00 per day NEVER GOING TO HAPPEN AGAIN. We couldn't even connect to wifi because they said it's not compatible with your devices, really ? They want you to buy into the timeshare, rooms are in desperate need or attention. Whirlpool baths have sings that say 'jets not working', so get the technician in a FIX THEM ! These tubs are so easy to fix. Children running back and forth, doors slamming, elevators out of service. Diamond resorts needs to step it up ! The location is decent but the resort is lacking. There are so many other timeshares that are worth the money, and no
Manager Response: We are truly sorry to hear you did not enjoy your time with us, however we greatly appreciate your feedback. The resort fees are a standard and include access to fitness center, dry sauna, complimentary bike rental, billiards, beachfront swimming pool, whirlpool and parking, business center computer/internet and boarding pass printing. We are also currently working on resolving our Whirlpool baths already. Thank you for your constructive comments, we will be sharing them with our team as we work on improvements. -GP

Summary: It's been a dream! Great weather, clean and beautiful resort, everyone caters to all needs asked!! Very friendly and helpful: They have a wonderful mission, San Juan Capistrano that is great to tour and historic town. They have a wonderful Harbor with many choices to dine. You're just a boat ride away from Catalina Island! Come visit, dine and enjoy! So relaxing and beautiful!!
Manager Response: Thanks for the positive review, Christine! Don't be a stranger now and come back whenever you want to unwind. -HN

Summary: We have been here many times!  The location is terrific to just enjoy the ocean or enjoy go into town and enjoy the numerous options there.  The facility has beautiful rooms, bathrooms, and living area.  Also has a nice dining area with a great stovetop kitchen.  We come as often as we can.
Manager Response: Glad to hear you enjoy our location so much. We'll be looking forward to welcoming you back next time! -GP

Summary: Good location among Dana Point. San Juan Capistrano, and San Clemente,. but slightly run down; crowded parking; and, and highway access is  terrifying.  Went to a “hour timeshare presentation” which turned into three additional hours hours of browbeating, high pressure sales.  The rest of the staff is nice and polite..
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your feedback. -GP

Summary: Wonderful view and nice rooms but we are on the third floor and the elevator has been out of commission for a long time. Staff is very friendly and helpful.  Units are nice and there is off street parking.  The pools are outside; so, it is hard to use in cooler weather.  The do have a number of activities for families.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. Happy holidays! -GP

Summary Heading: Nice place if you've been suckered into Diamond
Summary: I want to review this resort but make it clear that I believe becoming an "owner" at Diamond resorts is the single most significant financial blunder of my life. But since I am stuck for the rest of my life paying an ever escalating maintenance fee, (now over $5000 per year), my challenge is to find the few available spots at the choice locations. I was pleasantly surprised I could get in here (at a beach resort in December) but I did (a minor miracle) and the rooms are accepable and the location is great.  I would definately recommend staying here and if you book it online you'll have more selection and a better price than the "owners" like me.
Manager Response: Thank you for staying with us. We hope you continue to have wonderful vacations with us. -GP

Summary Heading: Some of the Best Staff I've Seen for a Diamond Resort
Summary: I give the staff an overall 5-star rating. This includes the concierge, the manager, maintenance and support staff. The resort room accommodations are more like a 3-star rating. This resort was recently acquired by Diamond Resorts which is putting in quite an investment to boost this property’s rating which is a really good thing. You can see that the original resort design was an issue in putting a resort along a narrow swath of real estate along the highway directly across the ocean and making it work. About ½ the rooms are facing the ocean and ½ the rooms are facing a wall or the side of a mountain just a few yards away with little light coming thru. You are either lucky or unlucky in your room assignment and won’t have much of a say in it even when you check in or even call
Manager Response: We are happy to hear our team provided you with exceptional service. It's always a pleasure to make our guests feel at home. Please come again soon. -GP

Summary: The resort is great and the service is excellent. The location is in the center of everything we would like to do. The only issue was I just didn't like that the kids room didn't have a TV. We will definitely be back to visit.
Manager Response: We're glad to hear you enjoyed your time with us and we can't wait to have you back on your next visit. -GP

Summary: We travelled here as a group of four. I can honestly say this isn't what we expected. To quantify this review let me begin by saying that all the staff we interacted with were so helpful and couldn't do more. The maids, the maintenance staff and the front desk staff we all polite and helpful.  So why a rating of 2/5?? Let's make a list:-  1, We were given a room we, as a party, had asked for. This was excellent. A sea view on the 3rd floor. However the lift was out of order when we arrived and didn't get fixed during our 14 night stay. So we had to get 4 heavy cases, 3 sets of golf clubs and four sets of cabin baggage up 52 steps to the room and back down to the car park at the end of our stay, not what you want when you turn up or when you leave.  2, The cooking area, if you
Manager Response: Thank you for the detailed feedback and constructive comments, Kevin. We are happy to hear you had an overall pleasant stay and will be keeping your comments in mind as work on improving. - GP

Summary: This was the third time we stayed at this resort.  It was a Time share exchange as the first two times but this time we were put in a terrible suite. Air-conditioning so noisy could not sleep.Also no cell service. Suite dark (had to have lights on to see anything even in day. View was cement wall that was up against cliff with a fence.  Asked to be moved. Even though suites available were were told no. We were an exchange thru Interval Time share so told nothing could be done to help us. It was like we did not exist as customers. Very disappointing after such wonderful experience during the 2 previous times.
Manager Response: Hi Christine, we sincerely regret to hear about the inconveniences you experienced with your suite and will be forwarding this to the resort management for awareness. We strive to provide all of our guests with an enjoyable stay so we appreciate the constructive criticism. We hope you can give us another chance to serve you with a better experience in the future. -GP

Summary: Very disappointed with the hotel and management.  We spent 3 out of our 5 day vacation  changing rooms. managers Aziz Hayat and Joe Emma were very rude.  There were bed bugs in 4 of the rooms they gave us. I was humiliated and and discriminated against by the manager. They didn’t even offer any type of compensation for ruining out trip and traumatizing my children.  We will never return to this hotel.
Manager Response: Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We maintain a rigorous pest-control program and will use your feedback to strengthen our efforts in the upkeep of our property. For further investigation, please submit your claim through the contact information that was provided to you by the resort and our team will review the case promptly. -HN

Summary Heading: Excellent location, amazing staff and great amenities
Summary: The hotel has great ocean views, easy to access with the use of free bicycles and or  within walking distance. The staff and amenities are great. It is also close by restaurants and Capistrano Beach so grocery stores are each to access.
Manager Response: I'm glad to see that you enjoyed our resort and amenities. Please come visit us again soon! -HN

Summary: Beautiful room, comfy bed, fully equipped kitchen,  2 flat screen TVs and a great balcony with a barbecue,  the view is amazing.  The heated pools are beautiful and jacuzzis feel so good. The train does go by and your on Coast hwy...not so bad, I will definitely stay here again.
Manager Response: I'm thrilled to see that you thoroughly enjoyed your stay here at Riviera Beach. Your feedback is greatly appreciated and we can't wait to have you back. -HN

Summary: Floors appear to tilt to the east, leak under sink in bedroom,(repaired) loose faucet in bathroom. Workmanship on joints and around tub not up to standards. Stain in carpet is at least 2 years old, the AC froze up and my sister-in-law slipped and het her head.( this was about two years ago.) not the usual level of Diamond quality.
Manager Response: Your feedback is concerning as we take our guests' safety very seriously. Please send us an email at CustomerServiceSM@diamondresorts.com with more details about your experience. -HN

Summary Heading: Great place to stay and play
Summary: Great resort right across from the beach.Convenient location. Short drive to Dana Point Harbor and Capistrano Cathedral. Free shuttle throughout the area, including to Laguna Beach. Clean and nice rooms. Next doors to a delicious Mexican Food Restaurant.  Staff members were kind, cordial, and helpful
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback! We’re glad to hear that you enjoyed our resort and its amenities. Hope to welcome you back very soon! -HN

Summary: 5 Stars hotel, immaculate cleanliness, spectacular guest service, unique personalized service, attention to detail, and very positive attitude from all staff.  Balcony with view to the beach. Complementary beach towels, chairs and umbrella. Complementary bike. Free parking. Two pools with jacuzzi. Game lounge with pool table and gym. My room had two separe bedroom and bathroom. My wife and kids loved it!!!!
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback! We’re glad to hear that you enjoyed our resort and its amenities. Hope to welcome you back very soon! -HN

Summary: We go here all the time, it's perfect, approximately 30 mins from where we live, we love taking our children.  This is review is regarding staff issues (apparently new staff), although it's not all of them (I'd love to list names, but I'm showing some restraint), there are a few that ruin it for the rest.  Having guests over, we were reprimanded in front of our guests of day use rules which of course is embarrassing having to even explain the situation to our guests.  We tried to put our names down for day use the night before.  We were told it was full and to check in the morning.  We did and was given the ok by the front desk manager.  We never had any issues then suddenly this staff person who we never met, first accuses my wife of giving the wrong name of the timeshare owner
Manager Response: We regret to hear of your experience and will work our team internally to improve in the future. Thank you for providing feedback and we hope to have the opportunity to better your experience whenever your travels bring you back. -HN

Summary: We booked through our Diamond Resorts membership expecting their usual standard. When we read the reviews we tried to alter our booking and switched one of our 2 weeks to a place in Palm Springs but there was no availability for any other Diamond resort in Southern California so kept our 2nd week booking. The had a 2 bedroom booking and knew all of these were at the back of the building facing a 'dirt hill'. The first room we were allocated was pretty dismal on the second floor, not even the dirt hill view just a very close wall. The room had hardly any natural light and the 2nd bathroom shower did not work at all. We just got on with it but we did have a very noisy neighbour who woke us late at night and early hours so after 2 days we asked to be moved.. No problem at all,
Manager Response: We appreciate your constructive comments as it will helpful with any improvements needed to the resort and are thrilled to hear we exceeded your expectations! Our team at Riviera Beach Spa Resort looks forward to welcoming you back in the near future. -HN

Summary: Well to begin Diamond Resorts says this is a resort.  It's not. Across from busy PCH and the train tracks it's not quiet.  The idea that Diamond can sell this for 150k is insane for a converted Best Western.  You can out lipstick on a pig.. it's still a pig. Then you can waste 2 hours having someone explain your timeshare to you. So confusing??   BUT it's located to some really nice places so if you need a place to sleep that's what you will get.  Don't expect to sit by the pool and relax near the beach without your earbuds to block the street noise.
Manager Response: Our presentations are not mandatory unless stated on your vacation package, and we definitely do not intend for this to be a negative experience. Your feedback is appreciated and will be used to aid in our efforts to enhance our guest experiences in any way possible.  We understand how these events could have shifted your view; however, we hope this does not prevent you from enjoying remarkable vacations with us in the near future.

Summary: My family came down with friends from the end of June thru beginning of July and had a wonderful time. Easy check in and check out - I am a diamond member so I knew they would want us to go to a meeting but we declined and I have to say ( even though they did check in after just in case we changed our minds), concierge was very good about not hounding us during our stay - so much appreciated about that. The resort itself like the rooms could definitely use an upgrade as well as their WiFi service ( which I know they were working on while we were there.) Otherwise pool was great and so was the staff. Room service was always on top of it with whatever we needed and were prompt and they always followed up to make sure we got what we requested. Overall great stay.
Manager Response: Thank you! We appreciate your feedback and would love to welcome you back for a memorable vacation soon. - HN

Summary Heading: DO NOT SIT THROUGH A TIMESHARE PRESENTATION
Summary: We've been coming here for years.  My parents bought a timeshare, they don't want to use it, we pay the annual fees, we get to use it.  This year, for the first time EVER, we decided to sit through the timeshare presentation because we foolishly believed what they said about a free 5 or 7 night stay.  We sat through 2.5 hours, got our certificate for our stay, and what a surprise - THERE ARE NO ROOMS AVAILABLE UNLESS YOU PAY AN AVERAGE OF $190 PER NIGHT.  This is fraud.  This should be actionable legally.  We have a worthless certificate for a nonexistent free stay.  I am an idiot.
Manager Response: Hi there, we are sorry to hear about this as it is never our intent to provide a negative experience for our guests. Please send us an email at customerserviceSM@diamondresorts.com if you feel your concerns were not properly addressed and we will look into this right away! - HN

Summary: How special this resort is...execilant staff....they take special care of all my needs...good pool and spa....the bed is the best....we have 2+2 and the sheets have diamonds all over them and so soft...I feel like I’m on a cloud....
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback – please come visit us again soon! - HN

Summary: I don't always get the chance to get away, so when I do, I am very picky about where I spend my time, and the Riviera Beach Spa Resort certainly did not disappoint. The attentive staff and and luxurious amenities provided a truly carefree weekend, far from my weekly routine. Each day began with a muscle relaxing dip in the jett filled jacuzzi and a short swim. While every night I was able to retreat to my spacious double queen bed suite with a full kitchen. Housekeeping kept my room and bathroom impeccably clean, and the staff way very quick to attend to my every need. I love spending time to myself, so I really enjoyed my quiet nights just sitting on the deck and enjoying the salty scent of the ocean breeze.  There were also various food and entertainment options within walking
Manager Response: Thank you for your feedback, please come visit us again soon! - HN

Summary: I just wanted too get away for a little while. The weather was perfect, the beach very calming. The staff checked me in very quickly... no waiting. I love all the new upgrades: Black-out curtains let me sleep in... something I don't get at home, New sound muffling windows blocked most of the street noise. The heated pool and Jacuzzi were easily accessible just down the hall. And, I loved barbecuing on my own Ocean-view deck. A friend and I played pool in the lounge last night. I haven't laughed so hard in quite a while. We will be going whale watching today... it's a great day for an ocean trek. The harbor is within walking distance. I definitely would recommend the Riviera Beach and Shores Resort for the whole family.
Manager Response: Dear Guest,  Thank you for the great review of our hotel! We are glad that you enjoyed your stay and hope to see you again very soon. 😁😎  Sincerely, VS

The second bedroom was small with 2 single beds and it did not even have a television  The unit we had 237 had a balcony which faced a WALL.  The unit looks like it has not been updated for about 30 years as it had the old large jacuzzi tub with a sign that said the jets do not work.  The window did not fit well into the wall, so could never completely close it. I think a family of about 10 elephants was staying above us.  It seemed that they were stomping around on purpose.  We called front desk, but they did nothing.  They are supposedly renovating an area, so there is plastic covering all over the 2nd floor near the elevator.  It can cause a fall if one is not careful.  It looks lke it

We recognize how any construction due to renovations throughout and around the resort could affect our guests’ stay, therefore; we do notify our guests through our website, affiliate sites and reservation confirmations of any improvements being made to the resort. These presentations are meant to be informational on becoming Diamond Resorts owners and it is never our intention to cause a negative experience for our guests. Riviera Beach Spa Resort strives to deliver an incredible vacation experience with unforgettable service and we would be elated to see you give us another chance to provide the exceptional customer service we are known for. - HN

Summary: We have stayed at various other Diamond properties and this is the first time we haven't been very impressed with Diamond.  I'll start with the POSITIVES:  great staff, good beds, general area is good (but sadly NOT this property), unit is spacious w a well equipped kit.  A/C works well....but see more under 'negatives', clean, comfortable couch.  Each unit has it's own BBQ on the deck.  There is nice art work in the halls and unit. NEGATIVES: property is right between a steep bank and a 4 lane hwy and train tracks.  If you are facing the ocean you have to contend w the traffic and train.  If you are facing the back you will be looking directly into a cement wall unless you happen to be on the top 4th floor.  In that case you look out onto a wilderness mountainside.  The back is

Summary Heading: Nice view but not a great beach
Summary: My wife and I stayed here for a week in order to visit family and for that purpose, the Riviera Beach Spa Resort served our needs quite well.  If we were looking for a vacation spot we would likely go elsewhere.  We were in the Phase 1 building which has been completely renovated and was quite nice.  Renovations were ongoing at other units.  We stayed at this resort as  part of a "sampler package" we purchased from Diamond Resorts last year.  Fortunately that meant that we were given a unit with an ocean view.  I understand that those who trade in through RCI etc get units in the back that look directly into a steep hillside that is very close to the building.  Our unit had a nice balcony on the first floor which is on the second story of the building above the round floor

Summary: A pleasant surprise- property is beautiful, convenient and has an awesome view of the Pacific.  Staff is amazingly friendly.  One bedroom apartment is very well equipped and comfortable.  We definitely recommend this property and will look forward to returning in the future.  Happy people we are!

We arrived and were placed in a room on a floor where all of the rooms appeared to be under renovation. We endured workmen arriving at 7 to 8 am, hammering and talking. To add to this, there were strong paint fumes and other odors. We asked for a room in another area, but were told none were available. We finally checked out early and found other accommodations. Upon check out, I explained that our stay was ruined by the room construction. All around. The desk clerk said they would have telephoned to let us know of this issue if they had our number. I am not sure I have ever given my cell number when making reservations. And, why didn’t they explain this at cell in? Overall, I am sorry, but cannot, in good conscience, give the Riviera a positive review. Oh, yes, and they tried

Our top priority is guest satisfaction, and we certainly understand the importance of efficiency and hope this issue has not deterred you from revisiting us in the future. -TW

Summary: There was a major remodel underway that impacted use of the elevators, laundry facility and spa area.  It also limits availability of 2 bd units. I recommend checking with the property on when it will be completed if you plan to book. On the positive side, this property has great ocean views and close proximity to OC airport, freeways and nice beach cities to visit.  The rates are reasonable and reflect the quality of the resort, which needs updating.  The room was clean and in working order.   Unfortunately there is a persistent attempt to have guests attend a sales presentation, which we avoided.  When asking for a rollaway bed we were given an air mattress. I asked for a top floor room and didn’t get it, then heard the upstairs unit noise for several days.   Hoping that the

Summary Heading: Makeup and Lipstick Can’t Hide It...
Summary: First the pro’s: Mainly it’s the location. Only a 25 minute drive from John Wayne Airport, directly across from the beach, very close to Dana Point, San Clemente, Laguna Beach.   The cons: The room we were given was allegedly “recently renovated” according to the front desk clerk.  The couches had stains, the carpets had various stains, the upholstery on the dining room chairs had various stains.  The kitchen was the most basic and cheap.  Cheapest Home Depot cabinets which were already showing signs of wear and tear.  The appliances were very worn and overall grungy.  Went to use a dish and it had dried on gunk, then found dried food on the ladle in the drawer. So to be safe had to take every dish, cup, utensil, all the flat ware and put them through a sanitizing cycle in the

We appreciate you voicing your concerns and hope you enjoyed the remainder of your stay with us. Diamond Resorts is looking forward to an opportunity to present you a memorable vacation soon. -KG

Summary Heading: Lovely suite, nice pools, beach accessibility, but...!!!
Summary: First time using this property. The one bedroom suite was huge with signs of recent updates (LED lighting, lovely walk-in shower, convection microwave oven). The view out our patio door of the ocean was lovely (see sunset pic with this review). Enjoyed the hot tubs each day (outdoor only tubs & pools). BUT the PCH was just below our balcony (see pic) and could get a little loud at times. Then there were the trains (Amtrak, Coaster and the occasional freight train - see pic at train going by) which were just 200 feet away. I really like trains,but not everyone does. THEN to get to ocean/beach, you can drive or use the pedestrian crossover (remember the train tracks?). The location of this hotel is awesome.  Right across the street from the beach.  Met Ellen at the mini mart on site who signed out bikes for us and gave us lots of good tips for exploring the area!  Our 2 bedroom unit was absolutely huge and well appointed!  Flat screen TV's in 3 rooms.  Walking distance to very good Mexican and Italian restaurants.  Secure parking garage with plenty of parking.  So why mixed feelings when the room and location were top notch?  As I had seen in earlier reviews, we had a balcony that was literally three feet from a retaining wall.  The other windows in the unit opened up to a dirt wall and pipes.  There was no natural lighting in the room.  I am not at all picky, but that really put a damper on the trip for me.  Here we are in the beautiful

Summary Heading: The resort is very good.  Unfortunately, the Diamond management is not.
Summary: The front desk supervisor, Elisabeth, is very good and accommodating. We had problems both last Christmas 2017/New Years 2018 week and different problems this Christmas 2018/New Years 2019 week and in both cases she helped us a lot.  The rest of the local staff is also very good. On the other hand, the Diamond Resort overall Management has been poor in both booking and managing the units.  They promise the world if you join Diamond Ownership but drop the ball when you try to use their services.  I was promised that if I was Gold Membership I could book a year in advance and almost pick the room I wanted but when you try to do this you get "nothing available". We stayed in a 1 bedroom. The livingroom was higher than the rest of our room. The bathroom had NO storage at all. The livingroom furniture was old and warn out. The Metro train runs all day and night. The traffic was busy all day and into the night. This resort needs double pain Windows. The only good thing on this trip was the view. Also stay away from Diamond Resort. The Timeshsre Scammers will scam you or try the bait & switch to get you to sign their documents. Don’t believe them
