Summary: Diamond Resorts gave us a great room with a view of the ocean. Rooms are well kept and upgraded. Staff is kind and helpful. So far our stay with family has been enjoyable and looking forward to more days.  Thanks,  Ruiz Family

Fantastic remodeled unit. Very large for a one bedroom. The best sunsets are always here.  Would be very comfortable for 4 persons (2 on couch bed) as bathroom is available to both sleeping areas. Like new kitchen. Well equipped for 2. Feels like our second home. Nice bar-b-que on veranda. A lovely place to sit & read while listening to ocean waves.
Manager Response: Hi Shirley, Thank you for your candid feedback. Diamond Resorts cherishes your business and would be delighted to see you give us another opportunity to provide a memorable visit you deserve.

Summary Heading: Perfect location, so close to harbor, lots of great restaurants and the beach!  Love the hot tub and pool!!
Summary: It was close to plenty of great restaurants and fun things to do!  The beach is across the street thought you have to go down the way a bit to get to it.  Much nicer provisions in the condo than I expected: very well stocked for the size!  Would definitely recommend!

We have stayed here two years in a row after attending Breeders Cup at Santa Anita and Del Mar. clean, comfortable beds... the only negative is ... it sits right on the busy road.  Sitting on your balcony can be a challenge.

Great beach location. Many great restaurants in Dana Point & San Clemente. A couple restaurants are within walking distance, others are bike ride or a short drive away. There is some road noise but it gets quiet in the evening

Very spacious suites with everything you need for a great time. They also have all the amenities you need in case of a rainy days. Excellent weekend in a great resort. You can walk to the beach and a few good restaurants.

I have visited Riviara both last year and this year and I really love it. It is on the older side but is maintained properly. The staff are very kind and courteous and the property is clean. They have lots of options like free access to beach equipment, bicycles which are brand new this year, movies and games to check out and an underground area to play them in. Also, in the play room there are old fashioned arcade games like Pac Man and Galaga for a quarter for which for an old timer like me is so cool!  They have two very nice pools on the property. Both visits for me were so fun for myself, family and friends. There is also access to lots of restaurants nearby and nearby at the dana point harbor. You can take a free trolly to go all over the place. Everyone should go check it

Summary Heading: Having stayed here 3 years in a row and have enjoyed the improvements in the rooms and always enjoy the ocean view.
Summary: great view of the beach and ocean summertime has a free trolley as well as local restaurants within walking distance. 2 nice pools in site small market in site. A short walk over the footbridge to the beach.

We usually book a timeshare week in July for a 2 bedroom unit.  Each year the condition of the unit may vary as the management is doing upgrades in phases.  What we enjoy about this resort: 1)  short walk to Capistrano State Beach by using the cross-over bridge; 2)  free check-out of resort's beach chairs, beach towels, umbrellas, beach toys; beach cruiser bikes and board games, DVDs; 3) two pools and Jacuzzi for family and separate one for adults; 4) ocean views from the pool deck or fourth floor deck; 5) free-rides on the summertime Dana Point Trolley; 6) location is a couple of miles from Dana Point Harbor, grocery stores/Costco; San Clemente Pier and San Clemente Outlet; a bit farther to Laguna Beach; 7) Variety of restaurants in Dana Point and with a short walk on Pacific

We have a timeshare here. There is always some kind of problem or multiple smaller problems with our stay. On this most recent occasion, their "activities calendar" consisted of suggestions each day on what places to visit in Dana Point. So, no activities for the kids at all, actually (except for movie night and one night of smores on the beach). The game room which consists of one video game center, a few old arcade machines and a ping pong table was missing the usual broken foosball table altogether and now the pool table was gone too. Nothing replaced them. However the same old dirty-clothes moldy smell is still there, as it always has been. And on our last full day there water started coming out of the air conditioning vent in our room ceiling. This was the first time we had

Summary: This is our 2nd year in a row staying at this property. We love it! Although I was disappointed during check in that the city no longer allows smoking. I know I am the minority’ now a days but only being able to smoke in my car, isn’t very helpful as I have an 8 year old daughter with me and not only is it illegal, I wouldn’t smoke in the car with her anyways. There isn’t even a designated smoking area on the premises. I feel that we should be allowed to smoke on our balcony as it is a timeshare in which is paid for by either the owners or the people renting it out. Seems unfair even though it’s the law. Summary: Found the room to be excellent with a balcony overlooking the Pacific Ocean.  The room was large with a full kitchen including  cookware, dishes and utensils.  Everything you needed to prepare meals if so desire.  No on site restaurant.  Everything was in excellent condition.  The negatives would be the trains that go by [primarily passenger] though no horns blown.  The other negative would be that you have to cross the street to get to the beach.  Currently, the overhead cross walk is closed for repairs  However, when done it isn't a long walk.

Summary Heading: OK But Not Yet Diamond Standard
Summary: This resort was formally a Monarch Resort that Diamond took over. Diamond has made some improvements to the common areas, but has a way to go on the suites.  My unit was on the second floor in the phase 2 building. The unit was clean with new appliances, but the furniture and bathrooms were circa 1980's. In fact the spas in the bathrooms have been disabled. I was told by staff that Diamond was removing them and will install walk in showers. Good Idea! The beds were comfortable. One awkward thing in the bedroom was there is a sink - but there is a nightstand in front of it that renders the sink unusable. The room had a nice ocean view, but the beach was not easily accessible. There is a 4 lane highway and a very active rail line in between. There is a high overhead bridge a short

Summary Heading: Nice resort with a few downsides
Summary: We had a very nice 1 bedroom ocean view room (#421) with a 3 burner Weber BBQ grill on the patio. I believe the ocean view rooms all have grill on the patios...a nice touch. The bed was comfortable with a full bath adjoining it. There's a full size fridge, small dishwasher, 2 burner stove, and a quiet running over the counter microwave. Nice size living room/dining area with a wall mounted TV, sofa sleeper, and a chair. The walls are thin as we had to listen to our next door neighbor's conversations and whenever they turned on the TV. My hunch is they were just too noisy! The resort has a couple of swimming pools and hot tubs and a well equipped exercise room with an assortment of machines. The downside is that the room, although facing the ocean with a nice view, also faces the

Summary Heading: Staff is GREAT Amenities and location SUCKS
Summary: This is a time share but I think you can also rent these units. My cousin and I stayed here under her time share over the Martin Luther King holiday for 4 nights and what a waste. The staff is great BUT the furnishings sucked, especially the sofa's and the way the second bedroom was set up. The sofa's were so uncomfortable that my back is just now getting better. they say that they are renovating and I certainly hope so as this place needs a complete face lift. You cannot easily get to the beach that is right across the street because the Metro Link rail runs along side the beach and that is very noisy. I have stayed in a lot of places and this one is the worst.

Summary: We enjoyed our stay in a specious one bedroom unit with rail-track and ocean views. We walked to Dana Point along the beachfront. A short drive to quaint San Juan Capistrano. The swimming pool and spa were good. Two bedroom units have views of the hillside a few feet away. Parking was easy. The staff was friendly and helpful. The internet was strong.

First off,, the address is 34630 Coast Hwy, Capistrano Beach, CA.  NOT Pacific Coast Hwy, and NOT Dana Point, CA.  If you are trading into this resort, you will NOT get ocean view.  We were told that several times and heard front desk telling people the same as they were checking in. We were told there were rooms available ocean view, but not for people trading in. The resort is not bad, if you like staring out your patio window at a mountainside not 15-20 feet away, which continues on about 200 feet high.  I guess I shouldn't feel too bad, at least we were on the 4th (highest) floor and got a dirt view.  3rd floor and 2nd floors got only a black plastic tarp to stare at and it was not concealing anything other than a dirt cliff only 6-8 feet away. Took a week to visit CA..  Booked a one bedroom at Riviera Beach and Shores Resort. Had a view of the Pacific Ocean which was great.  Rooms are nice, not great.  Staff very friendly and help full.  To windy/cold to try the outdoor pool.

I traded using Interval International, which I've never had a problem with before. II confirmed our room July 18 for our stay November 11, however Riveria Beach had NOO reservation until that day we arrived. HELLO..Not sure how they can operate like this, only giving you a 48hr window. They kept telling me that if you have a confirmation from II you have a place to stay which didn't give me a warm & fuzzy. The room once we got there was nice, however if your bringing Kids, not Furniture friendly. Glass tables with sharp edges, we had to put them away so the kids wouldn't run into them. Summary: Ocean view.  Unit is good size and has everything we need.  All staff have been very nice.  Easy access to I-5 and various destinations.  Grocery stores just a few miles away also.  Road noise could be a problem for sleeping, so you may want to shut the windows.  Highway in front. Easy parking.  So far, we are very pleased

I was SHOCKED to find out two (2) days before my arrival (10/13/17) that I did NOT have ocean view accommodations and that anyone trading in will never have ocean view accommodations. Summary Heading: Great Place to stay, Awesome Location and super staff.
Summary: Great Jacuzzi's, Games, bikes, location, Staff.. No food on site, but room was Great.  Movie by the pool was fun, Ping Pong was great, balcony was fun to sit on and watch the sunset and Happy hour on the 4th floor is Great. S'mores on the Beach was a nice touch.

This is an old property - but - very nice.  This is part of the DIAMOND RESORTS GROUP . . . .   There is "nothing like" being close to the beach.  There are more restaurants of very high quality than time to visit them all.

Summary Heading: Great staff, nice property, beachfront - but train and traffic noise is a bummer.
Summary: We had a great time here! The staff was attentive and enthusiastic. Really enjoyed the pools, spas, free bike rentals and family/ party rooms. We enjoyed a family reunion here and it was nice to have a pool/ spa for the kids and a separate spa for adults only. The views were wonderful and everyone enjoyed having several meeting/ seating areas, pool tables. ping-pong and activities. The mexican restaurant next door is a MUST! The freshest, well prepared mexican food (and flan!) I've ever had. We even bought an extra quart of salsa and chips to take home and share. The only downside is the traffic noise and trains along the PCH which separates the hotel from the ocean...

Our stay was very nice, rooms clean, staff very nice, staff helpful, beach was right across the street, perfect place to stay with children.  The room has a kitchen with everything you need to cook meals.  It is perfect for couples or families.

Summary Heading: This resort is the BEST..............Great views, wonderful staff...........
Summary: This resort is the Best right across the street from Doheny State Beach........The staff are wonderful and the view is fantastic.  Resort is close to Dana Point Harbor, many things to do and places to eat.  Also the resort has bikes to able to check out and just go riding along the beach.  AWESOME

Stayed at this resort for 1 week in 2 bedroom unit #411, too bad no ocean view but still enjoyed balcony and used BBQ grill. Spacious unit, kitchen remodeled, old couch but overall great inside. Staff friendly and helpful. Kids enjoyed heated pool and spa, never very busy. Great location, close to San Clemente Pier and Dana Point, free shuttle to and from Dana Point from noon until 9 during summer. Overall 8 out of 10, ocean view and completed remodeling would make it 10.

Upgrades are wonderful. Rooms are now very nice and well lit. Bathroom upgrades are also great. The tub is gone. Replaced by a walk in shower.   Still only one elevator. Management still is overly aggressive about attending their presentation about spending money to upgrade our ownership status. Did that once, never again.

Our studio room was even larger than some 1 bedrooms I have been in.  Trolley stop was less than a block away.  Free bike rentals were great, just be sure to inspect your bike prior to leaving as my wife's rear wheel was shaped like a potato chip but worked fine. Nice to have a separate adult spa from the family spa.  Restaurants/bar were less than 2 blocks away.  Olamendi's mexican food was FANTASTIC!! Salsa was hot and the margaritas were award winning.

We have been going to Riviera Beach Spa Resort for 15-20 years.  We saw the decline of the facility and experienced the complete mess in administration/customer service.  Wow, what a change.  The rooms have been redone and are very nice.  Love the new curtains - what an improvement, love the new couches, love that there are TVs in each room, LOVE the new shower where the spa tub used to be, loved that the patio/deck was clean, and love love love that the people who answer phones are doing a great job.   We no longer have three people telling us five different stories about our ownership and stay.  It was so bad at one point a few years ago, I was recording conversations because each person told me something different.  We did not use the pool at all this year, so I can't speak

my room was on the fourth floor....its facing the hill this june 2017......  i was there last april 2016..i was on the first floor facing the street. they were street construction at the time. the room stinks it smells like indian food (FROM THE FRONT DOOR TO THE LIVING ROOM, YOU CAN SMELL THE INDIAN FROOD)  they use the spray and also carpet spray but the smell was still there. you have to live with it.

Had a studio apartment on the 3rd floor with a great view of the ocean and beach. Each apartment has it's own individual bbq. Maintenance and Front desk staff were very helpful and quick to respond to requests (couldn't start the bbq). Two pools and two spas available. Weekend was busy but weekdays were quiet. A busy street and Amtrack in front of the hotel. Common in this area. Free trolley around Dana Point from June to Labor Day

What a great place. Loved walking over to the beach every day and enjoying the afternoon sun at the pool with the family  We enjoyed the activities .The front desk staff, activity director, hotel service people were all very kind and more then helpful.   Everyone went out of there way to make our stay perfect.  Trains...My son loved watching them.  Not really that many. Great place to stay if you want to enjoy the beaches, San Diego, Angels game, or even explore LA  Thanks again from the Kansas family

Summary Heading: The Resort is still great, the updatesare good and I know that will continue.  I have to compliment you on the staff -
Summary: We had a lovely room (412) - the traffic is extremely loud but being on PCH and right across from the ocean you expect it.    Some fans would be nice at night (close windows to shut out noise). The location is A plus.  Close to so many attractions such as the Mission, Catalina, Laguna Beach, Newport Beach and my favorite Dana Point.

Summary Heading: Enjoy the area and resort, however the noise from the street traffic and AmTrack train is annoying.  Enjoying our stay!
Summary: Great resort for a vacation in southern CA.  Close to several beaches.  Hot tub open till 11 pm.  Deluxe Studio was a surprise - very roomy.  Rooms not fancy, but satisfactory.  Flat screen TV on wall in bedroom and living room.  The weber gas grill on patio is a plus too!

This property has both one and two bedroom units. It appears that for the most part (maybe completely) that the one bedroom units have an ocean view and the two bedroom units do not. The ocean view side is quite noisy as the highway is about 20 feet away and there are train tracks on the far side of the highway. On the far side of that, however, is the beach. The two bedroom units are described as having a "Hillside view". That is a bit of a euphemism as the view is of a retaining wall. In our unit, the view was of a plastic tarp and a "please excuse the construction/repair" sign. The "hill" side is, however much quieter. Parking was complementary and adequate. The elevator is VERY SLOW.

Summary Heading: Always a great location. Service varies from year to year.
Summary: Adequate. Seemed to be less people up front working in the lobby this year, and same three people every day. One was clearly new, another was older and simply not in the right job to be helpful. Never received the schedule of activities (or saw activities), and when asked about it I got a hard time being told it was in my check-in info (and no, it wasn't but even if it was instead of assuming I'm a fool why not just smile and give me one?).  The vibe up front made a surprising difference last year when it was electric. Happy. This year it was downright depressing. Didn't feel any excitement, no "we're glad you're here" vibe. More of a "whatever" vibe. People into their own thing, somewhat disconnected from each other and the guests. More like lower-paid employees now. We

We found out this property was purchased by Diamond as part of a foreclosure but with that said, Diamond is working to bring it up-to-date.  Personally, I'd like to see some newer furniture but be assured the televisions are fine.  A real positive of our stay was the great attitude at the front desk.  The staff is very helpful & cheery.  We were disappointed when we asked for a room change, however, and weren't accommodated.  We were not provided with maid service (you need to stay a week my husband was told) so I had to ask for additional towels.  There aren't many one bedroom units so be aware of that if you are wanting one bedroom.  Having a kitchen was such a nice plus. The noise from a room overlooking the road is a bit rough on those seniors such as ourselves that need a

We are happy to hear our spacious and comfortable living arrangements, exceptional customer service and convenient location.
