We are glad to hear you had an overall pleasurable vacation. Diamond Resorts International® would be elated to have you vacation with us with all your future travels!

Summary: This property has not been owned by the current owners very long so hopefully they continue to update it. It is in a very conveinent location dirrectly across the street from the beach but it is on a busy highway and you have to walk down a ways to cross it. It has underground parking and there is a Costco closeby, that is always a nice bonus when you are staying in a condo type unit. The staff was very helpful and gave us several suggestions on places to eat and things to do.

Summary Heading: Can't Get Any Closer To The Ocean.....
Summary: This 4 story resort is right on Pacific Coast Highway.  All that separates you from the great Pacific are the road, the train tracks, a narrow parking lot (also part of the oceanside bike path), and some rocks.  The suites have been refurbished fairly recently.  We stayed in a 2 bedroom, 2 bath.  One bedroom has a king-size bed, the other 2 twins.  The living room sectional sofa opens to a queen bed.  The living room has a new 50" flat screen. Each bedroom has a  slightly smaller tv. The kitchen is small and has no oven, but does have a convection microwave, dishwasher, and electric cooktop.  Basic kitchenware is provided - some good brands of cookware.  We wished for more dishes.  Dining room table seats 6.  The living room has a slider which opens to a good-sized balcony - and

This property was purchased by Diamond International as part of a foreclosure.  Facility is quite dated and in need of an overhaul.  For some reason my wife and I were assigned a one bedroom with a handicapped equipped bathroom.  I called the front desk upon check in and was told that the facility's one bedrooms were all "handicapped".  I asked them about a two bedroom and was told that all were booked. Noise is a MAJOR problem at this facility.   The resort faces a train track that has commuter trains flying by every 20 minutes or so.  In addition there is HEAVY truck traffic on the Pacific Coast Highway right outside our 2nd story window. Front desk help was very helpful in helping find local attractions
Manager Response: We appreciate your candid feedback. We are working continuously to upkeep our resort as we strive to provide a flawless vacation experience to all members, owners, and guests. Rest assured our front desk staff makes every attempt to accommodate any and all guest requests; however, requests are based on availability and occupancy. Diamond Resorts International® hopes the remainder of your stay was pleasant and hope you keep us in mind with your future travels.

Summary: It is as good as it's advertised, daughter and grad daughter came with is. We celebrated my wife's 65th birthday. Spent time in the beach. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Close to Dana Pt marina and good resturants

Summary Heading: Comfortable Beach House with Friendly 5 Star Staff
Summary: I commend Elizabeth Santiago at the Front Desk and Ernest the Manger for their friendly and professional service.  From helpful tips from Donavon at the front desk to the maintenance gentleman to Ellen who smiled and shook my hand by the activity center as I was leaving for the parking garage, everyone I met on the staff was friendly, professional and helpful.   Thank you for your extraordinary and patient efforts in working with me so I could enjoy celebrating a special milestone in my journey with cancer despite an unforeseeable reservation issue.  It's a great location and a great staff and I will be a repeat Diamond customer at this location. We will all be thrilled when the renovation is over, but I I've been here twice despite that and will return.  Kind regards, Deanna

Summary Heading: Some Good News, and Some Not so Good News
Summary: We own about 3 mo of Diamond Resort Time, and have been delighted with the luxury and attention to detail at Diamond properties in the US and abroad.  We were prepared for construction on the property as we had received notices that there was construction on the property. Even with upgrades, this property is going to be pretty basic.  The construction was not a problem, with the exception of long elevator waits, as they used the regular elevator to transport building materials and equipment.  The problem is that this is not a resort, nor a spa---it is "Beach front" only if you have wings.  Driving to Dana Point Harbor is a good move, as it is classy, uncrowded and all the food is good at all the restaurants.  The property fronts (like 15 ' clearance) on a major north-south CA

Definitely going back to Riviera Beach Resort, Dana Point, California someday. Great location, staff, service, amenities, views, etc. Was my first time ever being in California, and it was a great first impression.

We had a very nice time at the Riviera Beach Spa!   It was clean and everyone was very friendly.  The pool and spa area was well kept!   Our sunset views were spectacular!     The parking was confusing at first, but fine after we got a map!

We stayed here for a week in February 2017, using points we have with Diamond Vacation Resorts. There was no problem during the stay, the place was okay, but there is no beach, it is no spa, and it is not a resort.  With whatever fairness is due, there is a lot of work being done on the property, so there may be plans for improvement. The facilities were adequate, the "condo" was small and did face the ocean (there is a little lanai big enough for 2 chairs and a grille) but the building is directly on a 4-lane boulevard, then there's a drainage ditch, a fence, a fairly busy railroad, and a waterside parking lot that looked like a crumbling seawall between the building and the water itself. Behind the building is a cliff face.  Not attractive scenery. To get to the waterside, it

I of COURSE, read reviews prior to booking. I took it all in, needed a place to stay in the area and brought earplugs. It was perfectly fine. The staff was attentive and the check in process was simple. Yes, there is a train every now and then. Yes, there is a road (PCH) in front of the property..all that was small peanuts compared to the view from an ocean front room...FACT. We were there over this past holiday weekend and the traffic was completely bearable. We participated in a fun activity on Sunday, making sea glass bracelets. Our 'Chief of Fun, ' Ellen Petrus was AWESOME, FUN and ENGAGING! Thanks, Ellen!

While Diamond Resorts has taken over this hotel, DR has a disclaimer on their site stating it will be 3 years before it is up to DR standards.  Supposedly this hotel has had some renovations. If so, it was in early 90's. We  stayed there recently.  We were given a "renovated ocean view room". Again, reno in 90's.   we were in second floor. This hotel has a bizarre OPEN courtyard type feature. They out a tarp across out of the top to keep birds out. Yet, since it was raining when we were there, the courtyard area floods.  This means as a guest, leaving/going to your room, you will trudge through puddles of water. The door frames have huge gaps which means light from the hallway comes into bedroom area and NOISE! This hotel is very noisy: door gaps, thin walls and traffic from

We arrived at the resort as the sun was setting. When checking in, I asked if we had an ocean view room and was told that they were only for owners. When we got to our room it was dark.  We had a two bedroom unit. The room was a good size. The guest bedroom did not have a tv. I sat on the sofa to take a little break and sunk down until my knees reached my chest. The cushions have never been changed. There was only one electrical outlet in the living room. In the morning, we opened the blinds and found Donald Trump's wall. It had a fence on it and a hill that almost goes straight up to about a thousand feet. I opened the bedroom blinds and was  treated to something black oozing down the wall. It was disgusting. Behind the fence was garbage. During the daytime you had to keep the
Manager Response: Thank you for your review, Room requests such as a specific view types can be submitted prior to arrival and we will do anything, within reason, to accommodate your request when availability permits.  As you may be aware, we are primarily a Vacation Ownership property, the offering of certain unit types is reserved for owners who own here. We apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused and are very disappointed that this has marred your stay. Your business with us is appreciated and we wish you the best on all your future travels.

Summary: Property located across very busy coast highway and rail tracks to get to ocean . Rooms were clean but very dated furnishings, no oven for cooking just a convection microwave . Our room was on backside of building with no view at all only of mountain dirt back , very close to mountainside . We were asked to attend timeshare presentation for a gift certificate , it was the usual high pressure tactics lasted about 2 hrs . We asked for a room upgrade to front with a view but were told none available . We wondered about that as the place was not full. Pool was ok , staff friendly and helpful . Mexican restaurant down the highway  very good.
Manager Response: Thank you GaryFruitvale, for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We would like to assure you that the impression you have stated in your review after your recent experience at Riviera Beach Spa & Resort is not what we strive to offer our guests and we sincerely apologize for any inconvenience you have experienced. As our property is situated close to the beach, it is not always possible to be placed in an Ocean Front or Ocean View unit. Rest assured that we take all comments and suggestions to heart so that we can improve and provide the exceptional service that our guests expect and deserve. We sincerely appreciate your interest in our resort and wish you the best on all your future travels.

Summary: My husband and I used this as a timeshare stay while we attended a workshop in Dana Point. Location gives it the one point. They were up front about construction going on. They did not reveal that the elevator would be undergoing "maintenance" for half our stay. I am walking with a cane due to a knee injury. The front desk directed us to the next building to take the elevator. We walked down there and took the elevator as directed, only to discover that we still had to walk down a flight and back up a flight to get to our floor. Was not helpful advice. We check out this morning, from the 3rd floor, and still no elevator (day 3, I believe.) they also didn't reveal that the train going by across the street at times shakes the room, though admittedly not too badly. I love that I
Manager Response: Thank you for feedback, although we are disappointed to hear that we missed the mark on meeting your expectations for your stay. Our elevator was out of service temporarily and we apologize for the inconvenience this caused. Please know whenever possible our front desk and management teams will do everything within their power to assign your room, according to your preference, availability permitting. We hope you enjoy your future travels.

Summary: Cockroaches! It smelled like someone had spilled an entire bottle of lighter fluid when we entered our unit so we opened slider to air out.  Queen bed - no window in bedroom. In the morning I saw a cockroach scamper in the microwave.  We had to go to a wedding so I asked that they fumigate while we were out. We came back late and again tried to air out. Next morning another cockroach tumbled out of microwave and I requested a room change.  They gave us a much nicer one in the the Riviera Shores with bedroom window and larger balcony. It smelled clean. But this room has lots of deferred maintenance as well.  PCH traffic and trains are very loud but wonderful ocean view.

Summary Heading: Great week and then over the top service when they Fed-Exed some prescription meds we left behind.
Summary: We had a large one bedroom beachfront condo with a balcony overlooking the Pacific Ocean for one week and thoroughly enjoyed it.  It is a short drive to Old Town and the Mission area with shopping and restaurants and we even took a train ride to San Diego for the day.

Summary Heading: Clean, friendly front desk, great location, very outdated furniture & bathroom
Summary: PROS: very clean, very friendly staff and phenomenal location. Easy to get to Disneyland & San Diego Zoo. All new kitchen appliances and great large screen TV's with good channel options. Beds are very comfortable, free laundry, nice pools and great beach access. Paper products are soft not sandpaper like many chains. Maid service is still to be evaluated CONS: Very old furniture,  leaning due to floor and building settling, some seating has small stains and cushion obviously lost it's stuffing, bathroom cabinets did not close, drawers falling out, could not use Jacuzzi tub per front desk, very outdated décor. Half electrical outlets do not work, back alley dirty & stinky. Parking is horrific if you have anything larger (taller) than a standard sedan good luck, staff parks in

Satisfied with the accommodations and location. Phase 2 pool was my fav because it had less kids, perfect for couples who want to enjoy some quiet time together. Phase 1 pool is bigger and has 2 Jacuzzis. Both pools get a good amount of sun. Our room was clean and had everything we needed, even the extra pillows I requested prior to check in. View from our balcony was gorgeous. Great location to people watch. Short drive to the harbor and plenty of restaurants to choose from. Beach is across the street but you'll need to walk down .5 mile to the bridge to safely get across. The only thing some might have issues with is the street noise; It's not a busy street late at night but if you're up you can hear cars drive by every now and then. Come prepared for that if you're a light

What a wonderful place for a hotel...look out your window onto the beach and Pacific Ocean! There is a highway and a railroad track in between so you can't just run out the door onto the beach but an entrance is not far away. The hotel is somewhat dated and although they are trying to make upgrades I question the quality of the upgrades. Overall it was clean and fairly well kept but things just didn't seem to fit well. The fridge door needed a new seal, the door to the deck didn't quite close right. The windows looked like they had never been washed on the outside (perhaps this had to do with the salt water in the air?). Overall we enjoyed our stay, it is a wonderful area as long as you have a vehicle to get around in. We would stay here again!
Manager Response: We are very grateful in reading you enjoyed the convenient location of our resort. Located right off the beach and within nearby services, it sounds as though you were able to create many priceless memories during your stay with us. Our team wishes to be made aware of any matters with amenities that may occur during vacation. This allows us the opportunity to correct anything that needs our immediate attention to make sure your vacation continues smoothly. Thank you for making us aware. We look forward to seeing you again in the future.

Summary: After a 20 day of travelling we where glad to arrive here looked really nice from the outside and had friendly staff at check in. We had booked a sea view room and had emailed conformation from the hotel weeks in advance to say we had a top floor sea views room. Paid the tariff headed to our room and the only view we had was the top of a retaining wall and a dirt bank of earth.  When complaining back at check in they had no notes to say we had booked sea views. So we where lied to and took money for sea views as they offered me a small refund for the cheaper room. But where stuck with the bad views for 3 nights.  Hotel is in a great location for the beaches but you need to take a drive to local shops and restaurants.  Rooms are a good size and we'll equipped with a good bbq
Manager Response: When requested at the time of booking, personal notes are saved in confirmed reservations. While we are unable to guarantee requests prior to arrival, our team thrives to fulfill each request whenever possible. Depending on the reservation, guests are to receive the confirmed unit type. We are sorry to read you feel this was not provided to you. Please accept our apology in not meeting your request. We are glad to read you enjoyed our unit size, accommodations and nearby services. We hope you may come revisit us again as we enjoyed having you.

Summary: We stayed here in February (3 adults and a newborn) and our stay was great. The staff was very accommodating, rooms were large, and one of the pools was even heated. We stayed in an ocean view room which had a very large balcony with a barbecue. The kitchen area was fully equipped and made it very easy for us to travel with a newborn. Overall, the room was very clean. Dana Point in itself was nothing special, but it was a very easy drive to Laguna and Newport and we didn't have to worry about parking as with many other hotels. Great quality for the price.

Summary Heading: Requested ocean view, got a retaining wall
Summary: Even called three weeks ago to reiterate that I wanted ocean view and they said no problem. When I got there they played dumb. This is my view. The brochure makes it look great but it's dated. On a positive note, there were no insects, blood or pubic hair. Stay elsewhere.
Manager Response: While we make note of personal reservation requests, we are unable to guarantee these requests prior to arrival, however our team thrives to fulfill each request whenever possible. Based on your reservation, guests are to receive the confirmed unit type. We are sorry to read you feel this was not provided to you. Please accept our apology in not meeting your standards. Our guests are important to us and your feedback is key to where improvements may be needed. Thank you for allowing us the opportunity to address your concerns. We wish you well on all future travels.

Summary Heading: Beach sunsets are amazing in December
Summary: This is my home resort and I have always had a good experience here.  The pools are nice.  Last time there they erected an inflatable screen at night and we watched the movie "Saving Mr Banks."  The best dinnertime restaurant within walking distance is "Augostino's Italian."  The Coach House is nearby for live music and dinner.  I have even gone to the Dana Point Christmas Boat Parade during one of my stays.  Of course, the Dana Point Harbor is another excellent place for dinner.  The resort has bikes available and you can ride to the harbor.  It is also right across from Doheny State Park, so you can ride the bike south from the resort, cross over PCH and go into the park for a nice ride.  If you like to walk, there is a pedestrian bridge to cross over, again south of the

We exchanged our timeshare for a week at this timeshare property.  The unit was spacious and they had underground parking.  We had an ocean view, but it was not possible to get to the beach because of busy highway, railroad tracks and fence.  There was an overhead walking bridge, but the city tore it down before providing an alternative.  We had a balcony with a Weber Grill.  Our unit was quite dated with a broken down, faded couch.  We were right across from the laundry, which was free, so that was nice.  The unit had a very large tub, but we were not allowed to use the jets.  The tub was installed incorrectly because if one wanted to take a bath, they had to climb in the tube to stop up the drain before starting the water.  We were asked to listen to their timeshare

We made a trip to this resort on October 2015. It was our 3rd time at this place, and despite being Diamond resorts owners, we did not get a renovated room at that time. However, we got a very nice unit that was in need of improvement but still worked. We decided to give them another opportunity and just went back this month. Stayed from May 8th thru the 15th. Once again, and as Diamond owners, we requested a renovated unit, and once again, requested was not granted. It seems like Diamond reserves the nice units to customers who are paying per night, but owners (who keep paying increasing maintenance fees) keep getting the worse units. Now, we would not complain had we gotten an unit that was in good condition. It would not had matter if it was not renovated, nonetheless, it is

I came here with my husband and two kids. We loved that the resort had a heated pool and was across from the beach. We got the 1 bedroom with kitchen. It was great having coffee watching the surfers early in the morning. There are plenty of places to go and eat within 5 minutes from the resort. If you are looking for a peaceful and relaxing place to stay, this would be the place.

The facilities are run down, unclean and in a terrible state of disrepair.   We are Interval timeshare owners and have stayed at resorts across the country.   This is by far the absolute worst place we've ever stayed at. The furniture in our "suite" was run down, the queen best in the "master" bedroom was like sleeping on the floor, the furniture was cheap, scuffed and damaged. The AC dripped water. The carpet was worn out.   Imagine an old Motel 6 trying to be a "resort" ... there you go.  It is shockingly bad.   A "diamond" resort? More like a beaten up old tin can resort.  DO NOT STAY HERE.
Manager Response: Please accept our sincere apology in reading you were completely dissatisfied with the quality of your unit. We always thrive hard to keep our resort up to the standards that our guests expect, though we understand, based on your feedback we have missed satisfying you entirely. Had our team been made aware of your discontent, we may have offered an alternate of relocating you into a unit that fits your vacation needs. It is unfortunate that we were not provided with this opportunity. Your review is important to us and we thank you for bringing these points to our attention. We hope you may continue to Stay Vacationed.

Summary: This place is located right across from Capistrano Beach..  Great for all activities. with plenty of fire pits, a basketball ball court, and a massive beach.   the hotel is nice.. they are going through some renovations so I'll be happy to come back and see them next year.   The staff is super friendly and professional.  Free bike rentals a day, awesome game room for the kids, and a top of the line fitness center.   I was happy to see happy samsung smart tvs everywhere .   only some rooms have good views.. but all patios have a gas grill..

It is amazing that Diamond Resorts continues to eliminate costs but, our Maintenance Fees get higher each year? Example: we have a room which is nice and has a spa in the bath tub. We call down stairs and they state" due to water shortage all spas are being eliminated.   Does this mean our Maintenance Fees will go down?

Booked through my timeshare. Lovely place and great view. Loved the areas. Not a lot of noise though my room overlooked a main street. Every night was clear enough to see the stars, or at least airplanes on their way to LAX, lol. Beautiful place. No issues with check-in and staff was polite. No issues at all.

We are having the best time here!  Came for a week and weren't sure what to expect after reading reviews. Resort is undergoing major renovations, and there have been some minor inconvenience, but nothing we couldn't deal with.  Improvements will be awesome when finished! I have to say the people who work here are the nicest, most helpful people. Everyone was so friendly! We enjoyed the pool, the bikes, the grill, the beach, and the activity center. There are many things to do, and the area is beautiful!  We hope to return soon!

So many things to see from staying here.  They are doing some updating but this is going to a beautiful place because it is already.  Front desk was excellent on check in and very responsive to any request.  I will be back to stay again. Also a go place to base from to go to surrounding attraction.  Two different pool areas both clean and very comfortable furniture.  Kitchens were well supplied and had a gas grill on the patio.

My room was extremely clean and looked new.  We had a balcony and the view was ahhhmazing!  Pool and Jacuzzi's were clean.  Adult center is chill (tv, computers, pool table).  We rented bikes (for free) and rode up and down the beach for about an hr.  Used Lyft (like Uber) to get to dana point harbor, about $5-6 each way.  We had the suite so the kitchen was fully equipped with all pots/pans/utensils.  Great- Great wknd

Summary Heading: Nice place, but some shady practices
Summary: I booked this place through priceline, it was $75 or so, when I arrived they informed me there is an $11.00 resort fee.  OK, not the end of the world.  But they also charge you $100 as a dmamge waiver.  Most hotels take a credit card number just in cse you trash the place.  Once the room is cleaned and they see you didnt do anything, they don't actually charge the $100.  This place charged me the $100 and now I see I may not get it refunded for over three weeks.  That's ridiculous.  Why should I just float them $100 for three weeks?  Seems very shady to me.  The room was great, I stayed in room 350. The pressure in the showers are INCREDIBLE, view great, people are nice enough but the whole $100 thing just seems very inappropriate to me.  The TV didnt work they said their cable

excellent location directly across P C H from Doheny State Park / clean, family-friendly beach;  great proximity to world-famous attractions such as Legoland, Sea World, Universal Studios and Disneyland;  2 hot tubs, 2 pools;  free use of bicycles, DVDs; many family-oriented activities;  and .... we were quite attracted to the fact that each unit boasts a private grill : )  my husband and I were in the 'Phase 1' bldg - there are 2 phases: Phase 1 (older bldg) and Phase 2 (newer bldg);  we made multiple calls to maintenance; maintenance men were courteous, prompt, knowledgable and professional however we felt our unit was in a state of disrepair as .....   1) the base of our toilet was cracked causing water to flood the bathroom; the toilet was promptly replaced in less than one
Manager Response: Thank you for the many compliments regarding our great location, accommodating on-site activities and courteous maintenance team. These are the type of great experiences we wish for all of our guests to have when visiting with us. We understand, based on your feedback that we did not completely meet your expectations and for this, we strongly apologize. Had we been made aware of your concerns, our team could have quickly addressed these matters to assure your stay remained a memorable one. It is unfortunate we were not given this opportunity. Your feedback is appreciated and we hope you may return for a future visit as we are certain your next stay will be nothing less than Priceless Memories.

Summary: My family and I came here for a one night stay.  It was well worth the money.  Then do need some updates but it was still very nice.  The sun deck, hot tub, and view cannot be beat. The staff was nice and the room was clean.

Stayed here through a timeshare. Room had good view of the beach but you'll have to walk over the highway to get there. To hear the ocean, you hear a lot of traffic... Room was outdated and looked cheap. Could use a a little place in places. This is not a place if you're used to luxury, but it's a good deal to stay here. Overall a decent place but nothing to brag home about.

My visit to Riviera Beach & Spa Capistrano  We stayed in this nice resort from Friday January 8 till January 15. Upon our arrival about 11 am, the front desk associates accommodated us in few minutes and assigned us the unit. I expressed interest in an ocean view unit if possible. Ms. Elizabeth and Ms. Angela promised that they will try to move us if there's a chance to do so.  I received the good news from Elizabeth “manager” the following day and She kindly moved us to Unit that faces the ocean and we liked s lot. I am here would like to acknowledge how helpful Ms. Elizabeth and the staff at the hotel and I really appreciated the cheerful and courteous treatment from all of them, namely Elizabeth, Angela, Jessica,Matt, josh, I don't remember all names. Also Nancy and Pari

We booked this hotel for 3 nights using our timeshare. We absolutely LOVE this location. Even though the train goes by from time to time, it was less annoying then the man we could hear snoring through the wall at night. Neither were bad. We are good sleepers! The best part for us, besides location, was the bikes! They have dozens of bikes that you can take out. We rode 3 miles down Pacific Coast Hwy and felt safe. The weather was amazing. It was a good time of year to go, however a bit chilly to lay out at the beach, there were NO crowds! We found a GREAT movie theater nearby in Laguna Nigel called Cineapolis. We highly recommend going. The BEST theater I've ever been too! We also found a great restaurant near the hotel in San Clemente called Nomads Cantina. The food was so

We just spent an enjoyable holiday week at Riviera Shores on a timeshare trade.  The highlight for me is that it overlooks the ocean at Doheny State Beach (behind coast highway and active train tracks) with some fun coastal bike riding that I describe in my book “enCYCLEpedia Southern California-The Best Easy Bike Rides.”  The resort lends basic one-speed beach cruisers & helmets for free.  From the resort, you need to ride a half mile to the east (best to cross Coast Hwy and use the wide sidewalk there) to get to the entrance to bike trails that go through the park along the ocean to Dana Point Harbor, or a trail that goes 3 miles inland to historic San Juan Capistrano.  You can also ride to San Clemente on mostly protected bikeways.  Pedestrians can utilize a tall overpass

Summary Heading: Location! Most units have a beach/ocean view
Summary: Diamond Resorts now owns and operates this resort build from 2-3 older properties. It is currently being upgraded to their consistently high standard of quality and service. Our 1BR unit had a full kitchen, though some may have just fridge and microwave. We had a jetted tub/shower and a balcony with chairs and a gas grill overlooking the beach and ocean. A couple of very nice restaurants are within walking distance. Walk a long block to the footbridge over the Pacific Coast Highway and the railroad tracks to some very nice beach.  As with most Diamond resorts, daily activities were offered. I especially appreciated the on-site bicycle 'rentals'. It was free. It provided a nice way to explore the beach area, the campground, and the harbor area.  A small pool with locker rooms was

Nice place, super friendly staff (a little pushy on getting you to attend their timeshare meeting, but ok). It was my birthday when we stayed and they left cupcakes in my room! Super nice! Great view of the ocean. Every room is a bedroom separate from the "living room/kitchen", nice large bathroom. It was more than I thought I was paying for. It would have been nice to be told room service isn't offered daily (or during the 3 nights we were there).

The unit as updated, had lots of extras. Saw beautiful sunsets, surf rolling in. the trains were not bothersome. think the surf was louder. Pool and hot tub very nice. Free use of bikes and helmets. Access to beach was an issue. 37 steps up to bridge and 57 down to beach. ASK at desk how to get in to nice beach area in front of units. Can drive in and park but took us to the last day to figure it out. 2 restaruants in walking distance.

The overall hotel style is is almost motel but all rooms have an ocean view with entry from the opposite side.  Right next to Pacific coast highway so there is some road noise if your sit out on the balcony but since the bed room is on the far side our sleep was not interrupted.  The back side of the resort was against a hill with parking in a garage underneath.  Our one bedroom was nice, clean and updated.  There was a limited kitchen-no oven but burners,dishwasher, trash compactor,refrigerator, and microwave convection combo.  The bed room and bath room were fairly large and remodeled.  The bed was a comfortable queen. There are a couple of  laundry rooms in the resort.  There are a couple of  Overall happy with the exchange.  Not too may Southern Cal resorts are this close to

I had the pleasure of staying here last week.  My room a one bedroom unit overlooked the ocean.  The rooms are fairly large, the bed very comfortable, and it sports a fully equipped kitchen and Weber BBQ on the deck.   There is a fitness center, 2 pools, activity center and concierge desk.  All in all it was a pleasant comfortable stay.  The front desk is extremely friendly, courteous, and professional.  They will do almost anything to make your stay pleasurable.   The only downside is the foldout couch.   The couch is extremely worn and old.  The cushions are most uncomfortable and almost non existent.   Kind of an embarrassment to bring friends and family to a beautiful hotel with such a deplorable couch.   They even exchanged the cushions with another poor set ?????? Go

The reception staff and concierge are so nice and helpful. Our room is a one bedroom suite with a full kitchen. It is nicely yet simply decorated room lacking nothing. We have a balcony (always nice) overlooking the ocean (and PCH traffic and the RR tracks)..  The location is not the best if you like walking  but if you are willing to drive you have Capistrano Beach, Dana Point and Laguna Beach  close by.

The hotel overall is ok. The lobby is old and shabby.  The rooms are fine and spacious, however the furniture in the living area looked old and couch with armchairs don't look too clean. No housekeeping  on a daily bases - only once in 5 days. So if you are staying longer then 5 days , housekeeper will eventually come to make your bed.  White towels have scary looking spots. Rooms are very loud since there is a traffic and train right next to the hotel so you can't really hear the ocean, unless you are still awake from 4 am to 5 am when there is no traffic. If you close the window for the night time you might not get fresh air together with loud sounds.

This property is right across the street from the ocean and every room has an ocean view. But you have to go across the pedestrian bridge to access the beach because there is a very busy road and train track before the beach. The building is old but pretty well maintained. The kitchen is well equipped. There is a big flat screen tv in the bedroom and living room. Comfortable furniture and the bed is very comfortable with large pillows. The bathroom has a large shower. There is a vanity and sink in the bedroom that my wife appreciated so she could get ready when I was in the bathroom. Each condo has a balcony with a gas grill overlooking the ocean. There is plenty of free parking.

3* Riviera Beach Resort Dana Point Part of the Interval International resort directory Friendly reception The rooms are dated Next to railroad tracks; can be noisy Across the highway from the beach; there is a bridge over the highway a quarter of the mile away Good fitness center Two small swimming pools

We've stayed at several Diamond Resorts locations and this was by-far the most outdated.  I did look into reviews before going, though, so I had an idea of what to expect.  I hope that DRI works wonders on this place--it has the potential to be great!  We stayed 4 nights and were on the 4th floor.  The first train was startling, but we actually got used to it (and the kids liked it).  The traffic could get a bit loud, but could also be mistaken/misheard as the beach waves crashing!  :)   We were in a 4th floor unit in the middle building, which was okay.  Furniture and facilities need updating and the elevator (OMG the elevator!)... I do expect DRI will fix these things in time (and hopefully install another elevator or 2).   Very convenient location to the walking overpass to

Summary Heading: Needs an immediate renovation and is on the PCH adjacent to the train track.
Summary: I wish I had listened to the TA reviews, both good and bad.  But, as Diamond Resorts members we believed the property would meet Diamond standards.  Well, it did not.  Although Diamond Resorts can't do much about the location, I wonder why Diamond Resorts would even purchase such a declining property is a not so good location.  First, the trains and the traffic are awful so we had to get ear plugs to sleep.  The property is on the East side of the PCH across from the Capistrano Beach which is also adjacent to the train tracks and a long parking lot which seems to serve as a RV park during the day for people who seem to be society dropouts or maybe they are just surfer bums.  The beach is very rocky and not a comfortable beach to visit both because of the rocks and the seediness,
Manager Response: We assure you that we take all constructive comments seriously, and have begun taking the appropriate steps to correct the issues described by you. While it is true that several of our rooms do need updating we are in the process to update this resort to our Diamond standard with a four year renovation plan. We advise all guests before arrival on our website that this resort is not at the standards of our others, yet. We do alert guests of the close proximity of the train both on our website and at check in so you are well aware how often the train runs and how loud it is so you are not startled. We are working on replacing windows and sliding glass doors in the future to help minimize the sound transmission into the guest suites. We hope you’ll give us another opportunity to restore your faith in Riviera Beach & Spa Resort Capistrano Beach.

Summary: Booked this online and delighted to say that this hotel exceeded all our expectations! Great suite with well-eqipped kitchen, jacuzzi bathroom, BBQ on private terrace overlooking the Pacific Ocean, two good outdoor pools,fitness centre and more!

Just got back from a 5 night stay at this hotel. At first impression it really is pretty dated and it shows, but that being said the hotel's amenities are super convenient.  It is located between Dana Point and San Clemente it has a full kitchen, clothes washer/dryer, bicycle rentals, and beach chair rentals all included.  This was not only convenient, but saved us a ton of money. The pool is pretty nice too!   It's true there is no housekeeping, but we clean up after ourselves and fresh towels were always available upon request.   Now the rooms...  We stayed in room 226 and my only complaint is the chronic leak from the ceiling right by the bathroom entrance.  The carpet never dries because of this problem.  Everything else was clean, but dated as mentioned before.  The noise

This has been a go-to place to relax and just chill out for many years - but time has taken its toll on this once-lovely resort.  The fan in our bathroom never worked, the sofa-bed sags so badly that we dragged the patio chairs inside to use while we watched TV, and there is zero light to read by in the evening, unless you get in bed.  The resort has added new flat-screen TVs within the past 2 years, but otherwise, it appears that no maintenance has been done.  The wall-mounted hair dryer in our room didn't start when I first pushed the button; on pushing it a second time, there was a horrid, rattling sound from it, and sparks and shrapnel shot out of the nozzle, burning my face, before I could get it turned off.   While management did make a trip to the room to check on my

Don't stay at the Sedona Diamond Resort either if you are smart, if your used to motel 6 then these are for you. We stayed in Sedona Diamond Resort and ir was dated and front desk were horrible also. First we asked for a room change were told no, asked about directions places to eat thing to do, we were told go to town and ask people there .
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to share your thoughts on our resort. Customer input is always welcomed and vital part of our ability to better serve our guests. We are sorry to hear about your dissatisfaction with your villa. Your feedback regarding the service shortcomings is appreciated also and will be shared with the resort management team. We look forward to truly exceeding your expectations next time at Riviera Beach & Spa Resort Capistrano Beach.

Summary: We have stayed here for years and are witness to the decline of the furniture and facilities.  The furniture is very old, stained, and uncomfortable because there is no support left.  We had ants in the bathroom which I know can just be an unfortunate occurrence, but the general state of the bathroom said things are falling apart.  Cabinet doors need to be replaced, exposed pipes in the bedroom sink area need to be not-exposed, etc.  BUT I found the staff to be very friendly and very helpful, and it seemed to be cleaned well which is a priority for me.

Summary Heading: an excellet place to make as a base for exploring
Summary: We stayed for a week as part of our calafornia US holiday from the UK. we are DRI members so we were intersted to stay at this resort as recentley been taken over by DRI. We found the resort very nice our apartment was very clean and we had an excellent view over to the beach. the road and rail we had read can be a nuisence we did not find this as the train comes and goes quickly and ocaisionally and traffic is not that bad at all.it is nice to have gas BBQ on the balcony.  Staff were excellent and very helpful and I could not fault them at all and I would like to thank Joseph the resort manager nd his staff for making our staff very enjoyable.

I wasn't sure what to expect after reading some of the TA reviews, but I was pleasantly surprised. I have stayed here twice, in two different buildings, and both experiences were positive. The staff has always been friendly and welcoming- even coming out to the pool area to make sure that everyone was having a good time. The rooms are very comfortable, and have stunning views of Capistrano Beach and Dana Point. The two buildings have different layouts, but pretty much the same accommodations overall. It's true that some remodeling in the kitchens and bathrooms might be nice, but everything was clean and functional.  Yes, the hotel sits right on Highway 1/PCH. There is no way to control the sound of traffic, or the train. If the sliding door is closed, there is really no issue.

I only stayed here for 3 days but was able to relax quickly upon settling in. The resort itself is facing the ocean, but with a highway and train tracks in between. I would of enjoyed an ocean view, but think that it would of been too noisy to really relax. Though my room was facing the cliff side it was very quiet and peaceful. Beds are INCREDIBLY comfortable and the unit featured a large kitchen and soaking tub. One thing I wish the kitchen had was a place to put my food, I had to keep it on the counter because there was no cabinet space. There were gas Weber grills on each balcony which was a great surprise!  The resort offers lots of activities for everybody, from a pool table to bike rentals, movie rentals even beach chair/cooler/umbrella rentals so you don't have to buy

We exchanged to stay here with our timeshare/points membership for our daughter's USC graduation in Los Angeles. Closest we can get, an hour away without the perpetual traffic.  We had a 2 bedroom condo for 5 sometimes 6 people and we enjoyed our accommodations. The staff was friendly and willing to meet our every need. Our 2 BR faced the hillside, not very pretty, as the view on the ocean side is very pretty. However, now that I read the Oceanside is not as quiet due to the traffic and train, it maybe was a good thing! All beds were very comfortable.  The master bath had a large jacuzzi tub with the shower in it. 2 problems with that, shower head not the greatest (rm 413) and you really have to master the shower curtain not to cause too much flooding.  The resort location was

This review serves as a comment regarding my vacation exchange in March 2015. This vacation, we decided to visit LA, San Diego, Palm Springs and the surrounding mountains. The Riviera Beach and Spa Resort adequately served our needs. Although the Resort was under renovation, their work did not interfere with our visit. We thought our room had been renovated, but there were several elements that still needed to be addressed (carpeting, tiling in the bathroom, painting). We didn't participate in any of the facilities because we were busy traveling around. Unfortunately, we wouldn't select this place to visit again. Once is enough.

We are Interval International timeshare owners and traded for a week at this resort.  We found it to be very clean and well-maintained.  We had a few minor housekeeping requests that were handled quickly.  The one-bedroom unit was quite comfortable for my husband and I.  The view of the beach was lovely. However, we found the first room they put us in to be extremely noisy.  Eventually we learned it was directly below the timeshare meeting room and we were hearing the loud sound of chairs and tables being moved and scraped across the floor all day long.  That, plus the roar of traffic and trains from the highway eventually became unbearable.  Nothing could shut out the din of the cars and frequent trains (Amtrak and Metro...all night long). After a couple of days of this we

My family and I spent 7 night's at this resort nice view of the beach outdoor bbq and clean room and staff was great anything we needed like extra towels, trash and trash pickup were done within 15 minutes of us calling front desk. Traffic and trains were loud but we have been here before so no big deal.   We look forward to coming again.
Manager Response: Thank you for sharing your experience. Our resort teams do what they can to ensure our guests have hassle-free and memorable stays. Looking forward to your return!

Summary: The Good Our two bedroom was very large.  In fact, the master bedroom was so big that it looked unfurnished.   Everything was clean and in good shape.  The Uncertain The location was just ok.  The highway is loud and busy.  Even on the back of the building you can feel the trains rumble past.  The Bad Terrible customer service.  This place is wall-to-wall with sales agents constantly harrassing you to buy a time share.  Any person you ask for assistance can't help because they are all sales people.  We booked with a group and had no idea it was a time share.
Manager Response: It is with deep regret and sadness to read that your recent stay here at Riviera Beach & Spa Resort, did not meet your expectations. We always strive to deliver exceptional hospitality and offer quality accommodations to each guest, owner, or member that stays with us, and it is very concerning to us that we did not meet these expectations for your recent stay.  As we are primarily a Vacation Ownership property, solicitation to attend a presentation is part of the check in process.  However, we take our guests’ relaxation very seriously, so we will make sure to address these concerns with our concierge and sales teams.   Unfortunately, there really isn’t much we can in regards to highway noise.  As the highway is very close to the nearby ocean/beach, our guests are literally within walking distance of the beach (there is a walkway overpass to cross over the highway).  If you are willing to give us another chance, we are extremely confident that your next stay will be much more enjoyable and even exceed your expectations. Your business with us is sincerely appreciated and we wish you the best on all your future travels.

Summary: Basic attitude of resort stag was unhelpful, unconcerned about our comfort or concerns for our stay. Everything was beyond the staffs ability to help because they weren't allowed to. Sofa bed was so uncomfortable it was impossible to sleep on. Had to put mattress on the floor. Small rooms. Would not recommend.
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at Riviera Beach & Spa.  We are disheartened to hear of your experience and would love the opportunity to further address your concerns. Please contact our Resort Manager at 949.248.2944

Summary: I was pleasantly surprised after reading some of the reviews the staff was friendly and helpful although a little outdated was clean and comfortable right across from the beach all ball there is traffic going by was not at all on unpleasant.  Will  recommend and come back again

This property has just finished a major revamp and it shows!  Beautiful decor, clean and spacious rooms, tidy spacious and well stocked kitchens, huge bathrooms, an amazing bed and a beautiful view of the ocean from the private deck that has a bbq. The fact that the highway is on front of the hotel doesn't even affect a thing. Very pleasantly surprised and I'll be coming back soon!

This was an Anniversary get away booked by my husband on Booking.com billed as a regular hotel. First impressions:  Very nice location right across from the beach with easy access to the beach. As soon as we checked in the sales pitch for the Time Share portion kicked in. After we squirmed our way out of that we got to our room which was a very nice "condo" style room.   Beautiful view of the ocean and the room was very clean. Once settled in we discovered the MetroLink goes by on a frequent basis which drowns out the ocean and the car noise going down PCH.  We did need to keep our window closed so we could sleep at night. This is a convenient place to stay due to the full kitchen and BBQ, but who wants to cook while on vacation? They do offer free rentals of beach bikes,

We spent 3 nights with some friends in a 2 bedroom suite.  It was exceptionally clean when we checked in.  Plenty of room for 4 adults.  The kitchen was nicely stocked tho no oven. The grill on the porch can be used as one.  The beds were comfy and that bathrooms large.  All the 2 bedrooms face the mountain not the ocean which actually was nice and quite for us. They do not do daily maid service which was really the only disappointment . The pool and spa seemed in an awkward place way at the end of the resort but it was nice.  The resorts location near the harbor at Dana Point was what we liked the best.  Also Laguna was a  short drive up the road as well as the Mission Capistrano.  All in all , we had a  nice stay.

We checked in for a 6 night stay as part of an exchange with Interval International since they didn't have any available properties in Anaheim for Disney vacation.  We were told it was one of their premier hotels and a short drive to Anaheim. Upon checkin, we were informed that there will be construction going on between 9am to 7pm which was no problem since we planned on being out of the hotel at those hours. We stayed on the first floor of Phase 1, which was just renovated and the work was being done on the second and third floor.  Our room was okay with a good but nothing super special. The location was nice and our children enjoyed the beach across the street but for the time we spent at the hotel, we were very disappointed: 1.  We checked in late and that night we started
Manager Response: Thank you for the feedback regarding your recent stay at Riviera Beach & Spa.  We apologize for the additional noise after the times that we had quoted, unfortunately as we were a bit behind schedule, this did require some additional activity on the floor above yours outside of these posted time in order to meet our deadlines and acknowledge that some minor noise may have been associated with said work.  We are sorry for the issues you encountered with your DVD and refrigerator but are glad to hear that our teams quickly rectified these situations.  We hope that your experience will not deter you from considering staying with us again in the future.

Summary: We checked in for a 3 night stay using Diamond Resort Intl points.  We were warned of construction noise due to remodeling.  Nope- nothing is happening to bring the condition up to the quality it should be as a Diamond Property.   Our room overlooked the ocean yes, but the car traffic drowns the wave sounds. Without a doubt the worst part of this vacation was the sales presentation or whatever name they are attaching to it.  Ours was supposedly just ideas to not have to pay our maintenance fees.  The woman that sat across from me at the table was haughty, superior and totally without courtesy toward me or my traveling partner friend.

Summary Heading: check in was easy, staff helped us with maintenance issues quickly, firm bed
Summary: We spent a week here enjoying some time off.  The room was on the 2nd floor facing the ocean, and while I had read complaints about the noise from the PCH and trains going by, we didn't have any noise issues at night or during the day.  If our windows were open we did hear the trains, but they weren't loud unless it was a freight train and they go by less frequently.    The resort is 4 stories with an underground parking lot accessible by elevator and stairs and they have about 10 luggage carts to unload cars.  They have a fitness room well stocked, two outdoor pools and spas, a sauna, lounge room and a video gaming room plus a small convenience/activity store.  They offered 2 free DVDs per nite per room.    When we had some maintenance issues, no pot lids, convection oven non

Old furniture from the 80's that was stained. None of the furniture was comfortable. It was extremely uncomfortable for a 7 day stay.   Concierge was useless. When we told them we couldn't find the pool, they said'did you read the map'. We said yes, so she pointed and said there is one that way and down there.   Room was not cleaned well. Dust on baseboards, garbage compactor nasty!   For seven day stay they left one packet of coffee and no coffee filters. When we called down and asked if they had coffee in the lobby they said no. We asked for coffee filters and they brought us three filters for our seven day stay.   No privacy on shared balcony.   Booked a room with jetted tub, didn't get it. When we asked twice about it they said they would check into it and never did anything
Manager Response: We are sincerely sorry to hear that our resort did not meet your expectations. Your feedback is greatly appreciated, and it has been forwarded on to our housekeeping and maintenance managers, for further review and coaching purposes. Rest assured, our team prides themselves on providing guests with the pleasant experience they expect and deserve, and we apologize for your uncharacteristic room conditions. We truly hope that you will allow us the opportunity to provide you with a much more enjoyable stay in the future.

Summary: We stayed here for our little weekend getaway with our kids 4 & 5. Perfect weather , heated pool close to our room. Rooms with balcony and gas grill. Brought food from home and whatever we needed Costco and Von's nearby.  Went to zoo mars petting zoo. Always great. Overall glad we stayed here. Already planning next trip.

We had traded for 4 rooms with II and were very pleased. We had beautiful views of the ocean and saw dolphins and seals and wonderful sunsets. The rooms were clean. The staff were very nice to us. We never were bugged with any sales pitch. We would go back.

Summary Heading: Lost time and Badgered to the point of tears by pushy sales people
Summary: My experience at this resort was disappointing. I made my reservation for Friday, Saturday and Sunday, checking out Monday morning. Because I've owned with Pacific Monarch for so long (seven years), it's under my maiden name. I never used it because there's never availability and the reason we went to Riviera Beach was because my husband, step-son and I really needed to just get out of the house.  I told them that my name had changed when I got there, but instead of making a note of my married name, they continued to call me by my maiden name (they even called my husband by my maiden name). They made an appointment for me to go to a preview on Saturday, where I figured would be a good place to update my information. Instead, I found out that Pacific Monarch (which I'm currently
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the time to provide your feedback. As we are a vacation ownership resort, we are more than happy to provide guests with the opportunity to learn more about our product. This being said, the presentation is certainly not mandatory. While our team has attempted to amend your concerns, we regret you have not allowed us this opportunity. We hope that you will give us another chance to provide you with a much more satisfactory stay, and we wish you all the best on your future travels.

Summary: This resort was recommended by my cousin who has been here several times. Well over a month in advance I made our reservation, with the request of the highest floor ocean view. I prepaid my room non refundable. RA week before I personally called and left my reservation # name and phone number with my request again. Upon arrival, the clerk was giving me a ground floor Unit! I asked to speak with the manager. He managed to get us a 2nd floor unit. Wow close to 2 months in advance but not honored. I spoke with the hotel manager Elizabeth who told me that this is a timeshare and owners have preference. But then she also said that even then rooms are assigned the day of check in! So much for customer requests. The unit is very nice. Right on Pacific Coast Hwy ( a bit noisy) but the

toilets barely flushing making very loud noises when doing so , stain on one of the beds , bathroom doors didn't lock at all .Disappointed we the experience !!!!!!!!!!!! cabinets were left open and towels were not folded and thrown next to the sink. the view we had was of a chain link fence, the light in the bathroom resembled that of a prison cell
Manager Response: Thank you for your insight. We regret the quality of accommodations you received from our facility. Our team intends to provide thorough and detailed service to each of our rooms. We hope you will allow us to gather additional details surrounding your room so that we may pinpoint the specific factors leading to a room not prepared or maintained to our high standards. Please also know that this is not a common occurrence at our resort, and we will make every possible effort to prevent a similar situation from taking place. We hope that you will join us again to experience Riviera Beach & Spa Resort in the excellent manner intended.

Summary Heading: seems like a great location but.........
Summary: We are owners in the timeshare that recently purchased this property.  We like the beach communities that line the So.Cal. coast so when we saw this property we thought it was worth a try. Our title says it all; a great location but it is isolated from the beach because of the RR TRACKS and a very busy highway. The view of the ocean from our 4th floor room is great but the noise from the highway and the AMTRAK trains that run between the hotel and beach make it impossible to keep our Windows open and is noisy with Windows  closed.  And when you are ready to go to the beach you can't get there by simply crossing the street; you have to walk, bike, or drive down the noisy highway about 1/2 a mile to an access gate. And if you drive the parking fee is $1 hour. So what seems like a
Manager Response: Thank you for taking the opportunity to express your feedback about your stay. We always appreciate when our valued Owners and Members share their experience with us. The resort is on a Coast Highway which can be busy with traffic throughout the day/night.  We apologize for the inconvenience and noise this may have caused. There is a pedestrian bridge about 100 yards south of the resort which will take guests over the main road and into the beach area which you may not have utilized or been aware of. As you know, we offer bicycles in our Activities Department which is a very popular offering as guests take the bicycles off the resort property and use them for riding up and down the coast and onto the beach area. Again, you may not have been aware of where to go based on your comments.  As for renovation, the Riviera Beach & Spa Resort is one of the newest resorts added to the Diamond International family, it is our goal to provide the highest level of guest satisfaction with our wide array of resort services and amenities and gracious hospitality.  We are planning several refurbishments in January of 2015 and plan to continue with each building for the following 2 years as we work to improve the facility. We hope to welcome you back again in the future for another memorable visit.

Summary: The travel website that I used to find the property did not describe it well, so I went to the resort's website, which was even worse!   They have 2 BR, 2BA units with a kitchen area that has everything but an oven, including full size frig and a dining room table.   Great space for the family.  Comments from travelers talked about getting ocean view.  Property is located across the Pacific Coast Highway from the beach and a commuter/freight rail line runs right along PCH on the beach side.   We had a rear facing unit which had a hillside view, but gave us a nice privacy factor without the noise from PCH and the trains.    Nice pool areas and free beach equipment and bicycles.  No restaurants, but several lunch/dinner spots within walking distance.
Manager Response: We love hearing about the wonderful times people have here at Riviera Beach & Spa Resort - Capistrano Beach. Although we do regret to read you found our resort’s website lacking in some areas we trust this has not ruined your stay. As we look to further enhance the overall guest experience, we take feedback like yours into account and will look forward to welcoming you back soon.

Summary: I must admit I was very skeptical after I had booked this place.  I usually check TA before I book but failed to do so.  So, after I booked i read many if the negative comments.  I was not happy.  I was thinking of canceling,  But my thought was I will give it a try as I had visited other diamond resorts and like their facilities,  I did stay and I was impressed.  Front desk very friendly and informative.  Front desk responded quickly to all requests.  Room was very nice, clean, spacious and with every thing one needs for a week stay.  They provide everything one could need for the beach.  Chairs, umbrellas, towels, and beach toys,  Patios have gas bbqs. Pool is nice (yes it did have some leaves) but nothing to stop me from the pool. Game room was a hit with the kids.

Summary Heading: This resort should not be called a DIAMOND Property Resort
Summary: My week stay was painstaking....room keys kept on needing replacements,  only cleaned our room once that week even that did not go as promised.  Our garage and entrance was hundreds of feet away from the main lobby where you needed to obtain any rentals and seek HELP!!!.  Shower faucet was not labeled and had very hot water and would not cool down.  Rusty plaster color down the seam of tub.  Always had to ask for more  bath towels only gave us two for most of week until they finally gave us 6 to shut us up.   Then the worst was their outdoor pool was not cleaned for who knows how long as it had dead knats, moths, flies and bees all over floating on top of water DISGUSTING.  Too many apologies for my taste on a resort deemed a Diamond Property!!!!
Manager Response: We apologize for the challenges encountered during the check-in process, as well as for any shortfalls experienced in your assigned accommodations. You will be pleased to know that we have a new lock system being installed for all guest rooms in November. The main lobby where all guests are checked in may have been a further distance from your accommodations than we would have liked however, we have 3 specific parking areas for each specific building for our guest’s convenience. Nevertheless, we apologize for any inconvenience this may have caused. We recognize we have opportunities at the pool and we plan to remedy these challenges immediately so we can ensure the cleaning efforts are ramped up.  Thank you for your feedback as it is a valuable tool in improving the guest experience and we wish you all the best in your future travels.

Summary Heading: This was the PERFECT place to be !
Summary: Spent 2 fun days with old high school girlfriends from out of town.  They wanted to make sure we had the ocean view, easy beach access, good food  & entertainment PLUS a great place to stay.  This place had it all!  We got a very nice 2 bedroom 2 bath suite with full kitchen, Large dining table and sofa sectional TVs in every room - didn't have the ocean view - but there are views in many areas so that was fine!   Even had a BBQ on the patio.    Restaurants were walking distance or just a 5 min. drive.  The resort fee included bikes which was great and took a nice ride along the beach!  Watched a great band and some dancing fun at Stillwater 5 min. drive.  Cannot go wrong - NOT fancy but just very nice and Clean and Comfortable!  Its the beach with class!    Can't wait till they

Summary Heading: What to expect at the Riviera Beach and Spa Resort
Summary: Upon arrival we found it difficult to park for registration and check in.  You can park on the Pacific Coast Highway or take your chances parking under the building (not clear what you should do).  Make sure you park under the right building or you will have to move your car.  After registering we met with the concierge and were told we would receive a welcome basket or package.  We then got pressured to make an appointment during our stay for a 55 minute "no sales" information presentation.  We were going to learn about converting Monarch points to Diamond points.  We were also told the Monarch maintenance fees would be going up etc.  We declined and were told they would waive the $20 deposit fee if we would attend.  We still declined and left.  Other people we talked to at the

Summary Heading: Ants and noise; weird smells; ocean views excellent
Summary: Having read these reviews in advance we were prepared for a bad time but actually made the most of our stay though it's unlikely we would ever come here again. Convenient to a (long walk) to Dana point beaches (Doheny Park) or drive to nice restaurant town of San Clemente, this place is basically in the middle of nowhere except the train tracks and a very noise PCH. It's a somewhat run-down version of a middle-of-the-road beach resort;  Perhaps when they are finally finished renovating it may be nicer; . the floors in the room actually sagged. there were ants all over the bathroom; Sand and a fair amount of debris in the (larger) pool. Navigating the different levels and hallways was actually a little fun since there is no "direct path" without going up or down stairs/elevator

We are Diamond Gold owners and booked a week here, we were excited as it was on the ocean. We were concerned about the traffic noise and the noise from the Amtrak that we had read about on here, but the Amtrak was no problem at all. The traffic was noisy but at night it quieted.We were surprised when we arrived for our early check in as Gold members that they did not know that we were Gold members, even though I had called ahead and told them that we would be checking in early, as this is one of our benefits as Gold. Upon check in, I had to show my card to the manager as she still did not believe we were Gold members. It was a little annoying with all the money we had to spend to become Gold Members and I had to wonder why they had not called to confirm with Diamond before our

Summary Heading: Nice location, even if it is loud.
Summary: We had a good time and enjoyed our stay at this location.  The unit was clean and stocked, and offered a beautiful ocean view.  There is a lot of noise from the highway and the train that separate the units from the ocean. The staff was friendly, even the three who spend two hours attemoting to get us to buy into their timeshare program.  I have a few complaints, however, and hope to see the improvements here when we make a return trip:  1.  The laundry facilities are terrible and overpriced.  The dryers take forever to dry a normal load of clothes. You need 11 quarters to wash and dry one load of clothes at minimum, 16 most of the time.  Crazy.  2.  The smaller pool needs a net handy to scoop out the flowers and leaves and bugs.  If someone is not on staff to do it, leave a net

We are very disappointed.WE had made our reservation 6 months ahead of time and they gave us a room with a balcony facing the sewer waters, fleas and bad smell. After  several requests they changed the room next day. The blanket was torn all the feathers and wool flying out.   I left my gold ring in the bedroom and it was GONE the very first day. We attempted several times to contact the management they were very indifferent in this regard.  Bad experience we will never try again this hotel.
Manager Response: We appreciate you taking the time to share your feedback regarding your recent stay, although we terribly regret that your stay with us did not measure up to your expectations and how unsatisfactory the experience turned out to be for you. While the resorts positioning may prevent us from being able to offer our best views to every guest of the resort we are happy to take into consideration any special unit requests when notified ahead of time. Please know that whenever possible our management and front desk team members will do everything within their power to assign your room according to your request but, that we cannot guarantee these requests will be fulfilled at check in due to the occupancy rates of deeded owners owning certain unit types here. While we are not responsible for lost, damaged, or stolen personal property including money, jewelry, or valuables of any kind, we deeply regret that this incident occurred during your stay with us. We assure you that should any guest misplace or lose personal belongings while staying here, if recovered, the item will be recorded as ‘found’. As such, our front desk team members will make a reasonable effort to contact the guest if an item is left in the unit after the guest has checked out. As a courtesy, and because we do care, we will ship the items back to their owner, at the owner’s expense. Any items in the Lost & Found, which are not claimed within 90 days, will be donated to a local charity or discarded. We appreciate your feedback as it is a valuable tool in improving the guest experience and we truly apologize that your item has not be recovered yet.    We hope this has not marred your stay and you will consider us for your future bookings.

Summary: This is my third or fourth visit to this resort. I have found this resort to be an ideal location for myself as I love jogging and being outside. The beach across the street is not that great however within 5 to 10 minutes you can drive to Dana Point or Laguna which has beautiful beaches or you can drive south to San Clemente 5 minutes, use the beach or the great jogging trail adjacent to the beach.  The rooms are actually quite large and comfortable.  I have always stayed on the backside of this hotel because of the train on the front side. This was the first time that I was on the beachfront side, however I brought a fan with me and I slept quite well,  didn't hear any noise off of PCH or the train.  (However I was not sleeping in the living room on the sofa bed which is right

While, Yes it is loud due to location on Pacific Coast Highway (traffic and train noise), the resort is in an awesome location, right across from the ocean. There is a Mexican, Italian, Sushi, and Sports bar within a short walking distance. The large pool has a hot tub and is extremely clean..but I do wonder if the locals access the pool some how. There are hotel sponsored pool activities throughout the day for the children. There is also an activity room for kids. The room we stayed in was renovated and very clean. The front desk is very responsive and truly caring. Looking for romance? I would keep looking. Looking for a stay with the kiddos...place to stay!

This is an older roadside motel built in the 1980s, who in my opinion, is trying to pass themselves off as a resort.  The "accident waiting to happen," is the swimming pool directly in front of the lobby.  There is absolutely no way I would spend any time in that pool, nor allow my kids to spend time in that pool.  It literally sits a sidewalks distance from a 4 lane divided highway with a posted speed limit of 50 MPH.  Add in 2 close by very short driveway entrances to the under building parking with no traffic lights---someday a car is going to be "T boned" turning into the motel and get pushed into the pool area. Summary: We traded into this timeshare for 1 week in a 2 bedroom unit.  The front desk staff, housekeeping and maintenance were very nice and helpful. Summary Heading: Stay here for the location, not the resort!
Summary: I am a Diamond Resorts member and used my timeshare points to stay here.  I booked my trip before reading the reviews on TripAdvisor, and almost cancelled after reading them.    I received a verbal apology from one of the Diamond Resorts representatives on site for the condition of the "resort."  This place is far from being what I would label a resort!  The Diamond Resorts tend to be more up-to-date in their decor.  This resort's bedrooms have a 1980's retro feel, but they were clean.  My friend and I stayed in a two-bedroom unit, which had a view of a concrete wall.  If you want an oceanview room, book a one-bedroom unit since there are no two-bedroom units on that side.  We checked out the swimming pool and spas, but there was some film on the surface of the pool water, and

Rooms were comfortable and furnishings were nice.  This is my second stay at this resort.  Close to everything!  Rooms are clean.  I stayed in 2 bedroom 2 bath.  Master had a jacuzi tub.  2nd room had 2 twin beds. 2nd bath had regular tub.  plenty of towels and pillows.

You can't beat the location of this resort and the staff is so kind and friendly. Dana Point is just minutes away. San Juan Capistrano old town is so quaint full of history, great  shopping, and restaurants. Plus you can be anywhere within the larger Los Angeles area within an hour or so. What gets me about some of the complaints you read here on trip advisor is how people complain about the trains and the noise from the trains. I assume they must not be from California because you can't really avoid trains here. The accommodations were clean and comfortable with a nice  neutral colored beachy decor.

We did an exchange for a week at this property and were pleased with it. I did read other reviews before accepting the exchange and found them to be for the most part accurate. Yes, it is right on the PCH and across from train tracks, so it is a little on the noisy side if you are ocean view. I heard that all the one bedrooms are ocean view and the two bedrooms have the less-desirable, but quieter, view of a retaining wall. The kitchen was nicely equipped, except for one cabinet that had a door you could only open halfway before it banged the ceiling light fixture. It had a state of the art microwave which also worked as a convection oven. It would have been nice if they left an instruction manual, as it was pretty complicated with a touch-screen and many features and programs.

Summary Heading: Capistrano Beach, Doheny Beach, Dana Point Harbor
Summary: Great experience.  Clean, staff members were bright and friendly.  The condo was MOR as far as furniture, but for a comfortable beach experience it couldn't be beat. Timeshares typically do not have things like, bellman, concierge, restaurants, private parking. They do typically come as full living units with full kitchens, closets, bedrooms. The person who wrote , "very little eating within walking distance" didnt walk 1/2 block. The postage stamp patio is within a couple of feet of the retaining wall.  No view... no sky!  The grill was very nice, however. Restaurant was not open at all, but no one bothered to mention that.   The room was nice and the activity gal was great.  Other staff... not so much. Very little eating within walking distance.  Beach is VERY rocky. You can even rent bikes for a couple of hours, only for three bucks! Only issue with the bikes is getting them to the beach. You have to walk your bikes all the way up to the stoplight, to cross over to the beachside. OR, you can jaywalk to the other side.   Overall, it's a good resort, perfect for families.

No on site bar or restaurant, the pool(s) is smaller than an average roadside hotel pool, there is no coordinated activities program to speak of. Basically, it's a place to sleep while commuting to the attactions in Anaheim, Newport Beach and possibly San Diego. I thought the pillows were soft enough, refrigerator large enough and  the pictures on the wall were quite nice. Yes,  the beach access is limited to one bridge..but there is a really nice comfortable feeling homey feeling to the units. The spa bath is HUGE, but the shower head is on a wall that requires that you stand at least two feet

Granted,  the beach access is more difficult than I like, but my wife and kids don't care one bit. Out of the many times we have stayed here we have never experienced filthy rooms. The rooms have also been remodeled lately. But it is really too bad the place is being compared to the glam of the Las Vegas Strip. The reviews here reflect the negative attitude of someone with wrong expectations.
