We traded our Lake Tahoe timeshare for this resort.  Good location, nice view of the ocean.  To get to the beach you have to walk about a block and walk on a pedestian bridge that goes over the road and railroad tracks.  You do hear the trains when they pass the resort.  One bedroom was good.  We have stayed here a number of times and would recommend this resort to others.

This is a vacation club type hotel that appears to have been converted from a hotel to 1+ bedroom  units.  The 1 bedroom is advertised as suitable for 4 but would be really small and cramped for 4 people. If you are on a budget  this might be a good choice.  Otherwise, it is not a 'resort' and not 'beachfront'. The restaurant is permanently closed and the spa is closed except for appts.  The step out balcony is barely big enough for 2 but does have a bbq.  It is located  right on Pacific Coast Hwy. across from the beach,but you cannot access the beach without walking a couple of blocks to the cross-over because the beach is fenced off. Traffic noise is prominent but did not bother me and I rather enjoyed seeing the campers across the road on the State Beach lighting bonfires at

Summary Heading: Average Resort with an Awesome View
Summary: The resort was average but the location was beautiful. The villa we had was roomy but nothing fancy you could tell it was older. San Juan Capistrano  was a nice town to visit but you really only need two days and you've seen it all.. Decent restaurants but skip any tacos, too pricey... We went to Ruby's Diner good food, nice view and great service.  The Regency Theatre was great to catch a movie comfy seats... Next door, you have to stop at FRIO good gelato... Marie Callender's great place for pie and food. Kids eat free on Tuesday and Saturday....  Carrows was another decent food spot.. We had our 9 year old son with us so we ended up going to all these family spots....We went on a Whale Watching Trip it was one of the most affordable ones but we didn't see any whales plenty of

Summary Heading: This was just what we wanted for a short stay at the beach.
Summary: We were pleasantly surprised to find that this was a spacious, oceanview villa with spotless furnishings, pleasant amenities and more than adequate kitchen equipment.  Another time we will plan on using the gas grill for barbacue and dining in.  Though not expecting luxury, we found the unit to be exceptional in comfort and convenience and look forward to return visits.
Location Location Location  Phase II units have completely new kitchens and updates throughout.  Phase I Units have new beds, bedding, carpet, paint, dressers, lamps.

Summary Heading: Damp feeling, and very little daylight.
Summary: Those people that say "great view", etc., didn't stay on the back side of the condos.  We were at the end furthest from the pools, but that didn't make any difference because the pool was too cold to get in to anyway.  Our deck looked into the hill behind the building.  I mean it was just a few feet away from the dirt and rocks. NO view, NO sun. When we checked in we asked for a front condo, as we had been there several years ago.  They insisted there were no fronts available, that we had to stay in the unit we were assigned to because that's what the original owners had booked.  NO way was the place filled up.   We left two days early and drove back to AZ.  Never again would we exchange our Maui condo for this!

I just stayed 7 days with friends as a gift, on winter break from college. Traded Las Vegas Time Share for Riviera Beach Resort. It would be nice if Interval International would do the due dilligence on a resort before they confirm that a resort is a 5 star resort. It's not fair to their clients to give up a luxurious spot and upon Interval's confirmation, have to spend  their vacation in a dive. When we arrived in our room, although it was a 2 bedroom, it was half the size I expected. The entire blind panel and blinds in the bedroom were laying on the floor therefore everyone from outside could look into the bedroom. The kitchen sink was clogged and the stove fan was not working. In addition to that, a rancid order was coming through the room vents for the duration of our stay.

Summary Heading: OK rooms, great location, amazing view
Summary: We stayed  here for a week while we visited Disneyland and Seaworld.  We stayed in the newer phase which was definitely nicer than the older rooms.  Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable with nice bedding.  The location was a great in between point for visiting both Anaheim and San Diego.  We didn't have a beach view room, but just a quick walk across the street would put you on the beach.  Beautiful view of ocean sunsets from the outdoor pool. Plenty of fast food and grocery stores within just a few miles of resort and quick access to freeways.

Summary Heading: The view of the retaining wall sucks!
Summary: When I made the reservation I was told I would have a room with an ocean view. I called prior to my arrival to check on the room status and was told I MAY have a first floor room with an ocean view, or a fourth floor room without a view.  When I checked in, I was told that when my reservation was made, by Interval International, I was put in a room with a view of a retaining wall!  I was deceived and I am very unhappy with Interval International and this resort.  If you want a room with a view, do not spend your precious vacation time at this resort.  I am disappointed and dissatisfied.

Summary Heading: Old and Dingy...definitely not a 5 star
Summary: Our room was okay, but not up to par. The furniture was old and smelly. We stayed in a 1 bedroom in phase 1 near the pool. No oven, gad bbq on patio leaked gas, tiny, tiny tv's, remote was covered in filth. The whole place needed a deep clean and remodel, BAD. Pool was nice and heated to 86 degrees. Jetted tub in bathroom, but not allowed to use between 10pm and 8am. Many of appliances are LOUD (tub, trash compactor, microwave)

we were very pleased with our one bedroom unit in phase1 on third floor, i was scared to go having read all the reviews. I think people are expecting really fancy and perhaps it shouldn't be considered a 5 star, but it was fine for a 1 week getaway. the front desk crew was always very helpful and  accomadating. They sent us a crib for the little one within 10 min. and helped us light our bbq. Note:there are 4 burners in the rooms which i didn't realize until i arrived, so with a bbq and burners you can make many meals. If you bring your own coffee grounds bring some standard round flat bottom filters. The beach access is only few blocks down and is good exercise! the train was hardly noticed, and i thought was cool (made me want to take a day trip to san diego on it).  We

Summary Heading: AWESOME LOCATION!!!  Wonderful Ocean View, easy beach access!!!
Summary: We recently came back from a wonderful 2 week vacation staying at Riviera Beach and Spa Resort.  We had a 1 bedroom ocean view room.  We were able to look out and view the fireworks directly from our balcony on the 4th of July.  The customer service was wonderful and the housekeeping staff was very friendly and quick to respond.  Beds are VERY comfortable!  The pool is perfect with a family hot tub and adult only hot tub.  You can sit in the pool and have a perfect view of the ocean.  Definitely will be going back again!!!

Summary Heading: Not the Mariott, but the view is great.
Summary: Spent a week in a 1BR suite with 2 teenagers in July. We exchanged our week at  Marriott Newport Coast Villas thru Interval International so that we change travel dates. This is a good resort for young families--pool, ping pong etc. .  For adults and teenagers--you'll spend much of your stay visiting the beach (across the street) and at shopping areas near by.  There is bike path (skate board path) across the street next to the beach and the resort will lend you a bike. You can skate or bike for a considerable distance along the beach. The accommodations were OK--not as nice as Marriott,--TV was small,and furniture a bit dated. But the bedding was high quality and and the bedroom had a separate sink/vanity that was a plus. Seating for 2 on the balcony with a view of the ocean

Summary Heading: Trading Places units are in less desirable Phase 1 building
Summary: Note:  This review is in reference to a 1-bedroom unit in Phase 1 building.  Cons: -Ability to change rooms if you use Trading Places as your exchange company was not considered. -Front desk staff were condescending about the fact that we had made reservations through Trading Places. -Spoke to Trading Places rep on premises to no avail. -No wireless service.  $4.95/hr. AT&T wireless service.  35 cents per minute to use computer (in adult game lounge near front desk).  Printer was an extremely slow dot-matrix.  Resort takes no responsibility for any issues you have when using that computer. -Comforter was wrapped in a sheet that smelled badly.  They said they have their sheets cleaned off-premises.  Sheets should have been checked for freshness before being put on the bed.  -BBQ

We just got back from a weeks stay at this resort. The front desk personnel were friendly, but we arrived at 3pm and could not get into the room until 4.  When we got our room, (not an ocean view but a lovely view of the retaining wall and mountain) things were ok until we went to bed. The main ac unit was in the cieling of the master bathroom and everytime it went on it was so loud, we couldn't sleep.The masterbath toilet kept refilling all through the day so at night we turned off the valve. so we could sleep.  I didn't feel safe with my balcony so close to the wall, we were just waiting for someone to jump onto it. The 2nd bedroom had an accordian wall to close it from the rest of the unit. The main tv had a bad cable hook up and didn't get all of the channels listed. Ever go

My daughter and I just got back from the WORST vacation of our life!  We are Hyatt Time Share members and have always stayed at either a Hyatt or Marriotts Resort.  When we booked with Interval we were told this was a "5 Star" Resort comparable to the Marriotts Newport Coast Villas, just north up PCH...WHAT A JOKE!!!! From the moment we arrived we could tell that we had made a BIG mistake.  Where can I begin...starting with the deplorable condition of the entire resort (if you can call it that) to the unacceptable room conditions and the unaccommodating staff, our vacation was a huge disappointment! We were given a room on the 1st  floor.  It was so noisy, due to the highway and the train tracks that were within a few yards of our room, that we could not go out onto the patio,

Summary Heading: ABSOLUTELY AWFUL - DO NOT GO HERE
Summary: This was supposed to be a mother/daughter getaway for my mom and myself. We are so used to going to beautiful hotels like the Hyatt in Lake Tahoe and the wonderful Marriott Newport Coast Villas. This was, by far, the most awful, disgusting, trashy place we had been to in our whole lives. The hotel is located right on Pacific Coast Highway and so if you had a room on the first floor (like we did) you could not walk onto your patio or even open the sliding door that entered to the patio. Also, because we were so close to the highway we were awakened at 4am to the sounds of all the traffic and the train. The 'ocean view rooms' are a complete joke, especially if you are on the first floor. All you look out to are some trees and plants and the highway. The kitchen was dirty and my

This is an older building but well maintained. Older buildings have issues, that is to be expected. Had two minor repair issues and the maintenance staff  responded within minutes.  Clean room with reasonable layout for quiet and privacy. Beds were very comfortable. Resort is not next to any activities other than the beach. The good news is it is just a few minutes from all activities. Great centralized location.  Staff helpful.  Great ocean views from restaurant and upper deck.

This is our first time here.  Our room is spacious, two bathrooms, 1 bedroom.  It has an oceanview which is great to look at from your room.  The resort sits on PCH 1 and Amtrak runs by it.  The road noise is louder than the sound of the ocean.  The windows have poor insulation.  If you turn your fan on in your bathroom and put a blanket on the window, it helps.  The amenities make it worth it.  They offer free bikes to ride, beach equipment and tanning beds.  The staff is very friendly and accommodating.  The pool is wonderful. Hot tub is hot with great jets.  The pool is large and heated.  Enjoyed this very much.  The deck on the pool is great.  They have put effort into making the game room fun but the video games are not great and many do not work, very lame.  They have a

We just got back from a week at this resort if you want to call it that. It is more like a motel with kitchens in the room. First thing was a bad switch in the master bath and the first response was from the guy from house keeping. He laughed about the switch problem and said it would be fixed. it took a day to get fixed but no one said it was until we notice the clean one installed. The unit was cleaned ok but could have been done better. The master bedroom was small and the bed was not very comfortable. They do not use fitted sheets so we fought all week with them. The drain in the master tube was laying in the middle of it some one unscrew it from the pipe. There is gaint mirror next the table which i still can't understand why. We were right over the laundry room and they

our first impression-OH NO! We have a time share with Marriott but decided to try something different. We traded through Interval. Big mistake (trading)on our part. From the minute we arrived we were disappointed.  The staff at the front desk - in a word - RUDE. The 3 people we came in contact with were disrespectful, argumentative, totally unapologetic, inattentive,defiantly sarcastic. It went from bad to worse. Within 24 hours, after 1 phone call to Interval, 1 phone call to Marriott, we were out of there! Couldn't leave fast enough. Both Interval and Marriott went above and beyond our expectations to help us out of a miserable situation. Both were extremely apologetic and accommodating. Riviera almost ruined our vacation- Marriott and Interval made it awesome!

Summary Heading: Great stay, no complaints at all
Summary: I stayed here the first week of January and was very happy with everything.  I had a one bedroom suite in Phase II on the 4th floor.  The view was fantastic from the balcony off the living room and the window in the bedroom.  The room was clean and well stocked with everything we needed.  Staff was all very friendly and helpful.  My family and I had a wonderful, relaxing week at this resort.  The kitchen has everything you need but a regular oven.  The microwave doubles as a convection oven but I never did try to figure that out.  There are directions in a folder though.  The bathroom was large and the jacuzzi tub was so relaxing.  The trains were not bothersome to us at all, we all slept very well.  Beds were comfortable enough and so was the pull out couch.  The trains start

Summary Heading: Interval International Rating Way Off The Mark
Summary: We stayed on the 2nd floor of the phase 1 building it is comparable to a motel-6 with a nice view of the Ocean.  Old furniture, hide-a-bed sofa had stains on the cushions, walls were paper thin.  At night we could hear the guy snoring next door.  Actually called Interval International our first night and tried without success to get another place to stay.  Something reeked in the open air hallway for our floor, I'm not sure if it was the dirt/soil on the sheer face of the cliff within arms reach or the exposed carpet on the floor but we ran from the room to our car.  We decided to focus on the fun we had on the beach in San Clemente and in Disneyland.  As for choosing this Timeshare Exchange we have learned greatly from this experience.

I was looking forward to a nice weekend get away with my husband and I was terribly surprised to find the condition of our room.  We had rustd silverware in the litchen drawers, the air-conditioning vents were caked with dust and the air-filter looked as if it hadn't been changed in over 6 months.  The view was great, once you look past the railroad tracks.  In comparison to the other resort which is offered by this resort chain Riviera is a huge disappointment.  Cleanliness seems to be a hard thing to come by at this resort.  I will definately limit my visits to the Vegas and Palm Springs resorts.  The Riviera needs ALOT of help.

We had two adjoining rooms for two nights in Phase 1 on the first floor.   The hotel is quite old, but they have been renovating and it is very nice.   The rooms have full kitchens with the exception of an oven. A mini trash compactor and dishwasher are wonderful amenities.   The living room had a sofa sleeper and it was the most comfortable one I have ever slept on in my life!! I was prepared for it to 'live up to its reputation' by bringing a raised airbed with me, but I did not have to resort to sleeping on it!! Yes!!  We had ocean view rooms which was a plus, watching the sunsets!!  We walked down to the pedestrian walkway across PCH to spend a bit of time on the beach. It was very close to the hotel.   They have children's planned & supervised activities, of which our

Just want to let everyone know - WE LOVED THIS RESORT!  The view of the ocean across the street is outstanding!  Yes you do have to walk over a walkway to cross to the  beach - whats the problem, as long as we can walk, let's do it! The condo is decorated beautifully, lots of room in our 1-bedroom, full kitchen, large frig.,convection oven, dishwasher, trash compacter, range and a huge BBQ on our balcony! Pool's are both super!  Jacuzzi tub in our room was to die for!  So wonderful to have bikes (free), lounges & ice chests for the beach! The train that goes by several times a day is only 4-car Amtrac and YOU CANNOT EVEN HEAR IT in the bedroom and barely hear with balcony door open! PLEASE DO NOT TAKE THE NEGATIVE REVIEWS YOU SEE ON THIS WEBSITE! It is a lovely resort  for the

This review is for Phase II, 1st Floor.  Rooms were cleaner than I thought, was pleasantly surprised.    Check in on Friday - 3rd Floor, Saturday check-ins 2nd floor, Sunday check-ins 1st floor. No Exceptions.  Trust me you don't want the 1st floor unless you bring a nice sleeping pill that will make you unconsious for the night.  The noise kept us up every night, all night, all week (except when I took a pill).  The train is right across the street along with the heavy PCH traffic. I also didn't like that there was no washer and dryer in the room.  The laudary room is on the 2nd floor for $1.25 for each the washer & dryer. The walk to the beach is no joke, we rode our bikes and juggled the cooler and chairs.  On a positive note, the hotel offered alot of activities.  Nice game

Summary Heading: Great Resort ~~ pleasantly Surprised at updated furnishing
Summary: There are such bad reviews of this site ~~ we were very apprehensive ~~ But were we pleasantly surprised by the Great overall resort and friendly staff and great amenities ~~   The 2 bedroom units have a cliff wall view apparently which is really upsettingto those reviewers but our 1 bedroom unit has a spectacular view of the Pacific with Balcony with its own gas grill. Suspect even the 2 bedroom units are much imporved now that they are renovated. Free bikes and Beach Chairs to use.  Nice pools and hot tub combs.
Our room was better than expected after reading reviews.  Room was very clean, everything worked.  Staff was very unfriendly and unhelpful.

Summary Heading: Riverra is a great beach destination
Summary: We stayed in Riverra Phase 1.  1DB/1BA ocean view  After reading the prev bad reviews, I went to check it out before taking my kids and grandmother there.  The Ritz is it not, but is was perfectly decent, typical of what we've seen in beach bungalows.  Kind of motel-6 quality furnishings, but clean and nice.  The value is the view - you can see the waves crashing, firepits on the beach, just down the street from Dana point harbor with shops and great dining, sailing, water sports, whale watching and deep sea fishing.  Yes, you have to walk a whole block up to the pedestrian bridge to the sand, or oyu can drive across the street and part ON THE SAND.  Hard to beat that.  Phase 2 and especially 3 seem more refined, so if you are into the polish, make a point of getting the newer

My husband and I and 3 small children stayed in their "best" 2 bedroom corner unit.  It was not clean; soiled furniture; air conditioning barely worked; refrigerator never closed correctly... and those are the good points.  Beach is NOT safe for children; you must drive to San Clemente for a good beach.  Bridge is not that close to cross over to beach.  Train and Metrolink run by the rooms every 20 minutes day and night.  We stayed only 3 nights out of 7. Checked out early and came home.  Never trust a 5 star rating on Interval. One of the worst places I ever stayed in.

Summary Heading: How did this get rated so highly by Interval?
Summary: This was a huge disappointment from the moment we arrived. Our expectations were high given this was rated so high by Interval. The elevators are pathetically slow and dirty. We did not get an ocean view so we were literally looking out the back of the hotel into the side of a hill within feet of our window. The carpeting in the hallways was filthy. The rooms were old.  Looks like they were lasted updated in the early '80s. The caulking around the bathub was peeling. The chrome on the shower head was pitting. When we arrived we asked them to re-clean the whirlpool becuse of hair. Asked for some additional shampoo, only gave us one additional tiny bottle for the remainder of our stay. This is across from the beach but also the railroad tracks. If your expecting more than 2 stars

Summary Heading: Very Over Rated by Interval Internation
Summary: There are 3 "Riviera" Resort locations easily confused with one another, Riviera Shores, Riviera Spa & Resort Phase I, and Riviera Spa & Resort Phase II, so I am clarifying which this review is about. This is about a 2B/2B unit in Riviera Spa & Resort Phase I that I gave as a gift to my brother and his family.   What a BIG disappointment!   GOOD: Location! Great view of the ocean. Unit was a front to back, 1 side faced the ocean while the other faced the ugly cliff, which was fine, as you cannot move the cliff. BBQ grill on each deck - they really loved this.   BAD: Furniture is old, carpet is old and gross, room overall is dirty and outdated. This is not a Resort deserving of any rating above a 2 or 2 1/2 out of 5. If not for the view, it would be a 1 to 1 1/2.   SUMMARY: If

Summary Heading: A very dissapointing destination in a convenient location
Summary: We traded a beautiful time share unit in Hilton Head Island for this resort.  There was no comparison.  Our view was a sheer cliff about 10 ft. away from our balcony.  Accomodations were adequate but cheap, rooms so small there was no room for doors to swing closed, plumbing problems.  Definitely a location you did not want to spend much time in--unusual for us.  It was a convenient location between LA and SanDiego.  Will I ever go back?  No.

Getting a room is next to impossible even though it's empty all year round.  We stayed during Spring Break and the hotel wasn't even 20% full but for some reason our time share couldn't give us an extra night?!?!?!?!?? To top that off we asked for a late check out and they said they would let us stay till 10 am if we could call the front desk at 7 am?? if we were up at 7 am we wouldn't need a late check out. We found shards of broken glass in the living room; fortunately they were found when stepped on by someone wearing shoes. Then we were playing a board game with our family and were told that the front desk got 4 complaints and they would kick us out if they got one more.  They never called or came to the door for the first 3 complaints? Can't a family play a board game
My family and I stayed at this property from January 05 to January 11. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable with great beds. I recommend Riviera Beach.

We stayed at this resort in the Riveria Shores Phase. The Riviera Beach and the Riveria Shores share the same lobby and are connected so it is really the same building the share,pools and hot tubs which there are two, bike rentals and restaurant. Each phase has it's own excercise room, game room, family room and sauna.  We stayed in a one bedroom condo that slept four due to the pull out sofa.  The best thing about the room was the balcony with the beautiful view of the beach and ocean. All of the one bedroom condos have an ocean view I believe, but some two bedrooms face a retaining wall.  The kitchen was well stocked with service for six. There was a microwave, stove top, and dishwasher. The bathroom was rather small and had a jacuzzi tub and double sinks. It could only be

There are large variations on the review of this resort.  Bottom line: it all depends on your expectations.  Interval International rated the resort as a 5 star premier resort.  While the resort is good, 5 star premier it is not.  People coming here expecting a 5 star premier resort will be sorely disappointed.  People coming here expecting a nice experience & a fun time in Southern California will enjoy it.  Pros: Halfway between LA and San Diego lets you explore all of So Cal's offerings from area beaches to amusement parks.  You can check out bikes, beach chairs, beach umbrellas, and sand toys for free.  All units have a gas BBQ on the porch.  Cons: The units are in need of some upgrades.  Furniture, TVs, and kitchen appliances are older.  This resort is located on a highway.

Summary Heading: Just a few helpful "hints" to make your stay MORE enjoyable!
Summary: I obtained this room from an owner that was unable to use due to a medical issue.   The receiption desk greeting was "neutral".  Smiles were hard to come by.   I was surprised to see that there was NO area in the lobby which contained the usual multitude of folders for nearby attractions/restaurants in the area.  There is a restaurant on-site and that is publicized.  You need to request PRIOR to your stay if you want a particular room, or area.  If you plan on using bridge for beach access, then you would need a southernmost room, or face a few block walk.  Also be aware that an extra car must park on the street and that parking is very limited so aim for the 4PM check-in or??   I suggest doing lots of internet research PRIOR to your trip, and printing out maps to get you where

In October will take my sixth stay at this location in the past two years. This last July had my kids and grandkids for a full week. The timeshare is well run and clean. The resort is about half hour from Legoland that the grandkids enjoyed. Most of the top Southern California  tourist attractions within a hour drive. They have two swimming pools, fitness center, day spa and a restaurant  with a great view of Dana Point and the beach. We did a little whale watching with our dinner. I do love the sunsets.

I was not enthused when we checked in for a two week stay through our timeshare deal with interval international. There was a musty smell from the air conditioner, and the place was narrow and dark. It turned out to be an enjoyable vacation. The beach is a five minute walk away, there are bikes and videos available for free, a decent workout room, two pools and hot tubs to relax by, and some good restaraunts nearby (by car). Our second week was in a two bedroom unit, which is on the backside of the hotel, with no ocean view, but that was ok too. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The place was clean, but not fancy. The kitchen was fine for a timeshare. I think the negative reviewers were too harsh on this place. I would stay there again, although we are looking for

Summary Heading: Great Ocean View room - crossover bridge directly to beach
Summary: Great location - walk to beach, marina, restaurants (Jolly Rogers/The Beach House close by. Check out bikes at Activity room and ride along the beach.  My grandsons attended a top-notch baseball camp nearby and this location was very convenient.  We swam at the pool or at the beach every evening, rode bikes, and barbequed in our own unit.  Didn't like that we had towels/bedding changed only once in the week, but we survived!  When I requested additional supplies, response was prompt.

More like a Motel than a resort. Everything was outdated. The kitchen was not adequate. The bedrooms were tiny and you could not open the dresser drawers because they hit the bed. The room was dirty and 80 degrees when I went inside. I complained to the manager and they were very rude. I had to call the main office to get some results. The carpet was ripped and dirty and the lighting was "energy savers" It was so dark I could not read a book or magazine after sunset. The restaurant was awful. The hallways had water damage. It was a nightmare vacation!!!!!!  DO NOT BOOK THIS RESORT!!!!!

We booked a 1 bedroom unit back in November 2007.  We were excited about our unit having an ocean view!  Well, it had an ocean view that was separated by the Pacific Coast Highway and the railroad track!  It was very noisy sitting out on your balcony..if it wasn't cars it was trains!  There was only 1 window in our unit...which was the sliding glass door (which was put on backwards).  The bedroom was small and felt like a dungeon...because there was no light!  In fact, we couldn't tell if it was daylight or night when we were sleeping.  One positive...the bed was very comfortable!  The bathroom was good size and had a whirlpool bathtub.  The company really needs to put some money into this resort.  It is very outdated...carpet needs to be replaced, furniture replaced, etc.  By

Summary Heading: Nice location, Nice view, Old building, decent room
Summary: We traded in our week through interval international to stay here.  This place is just decent.  We stayed in the older phase 1 part of the resort and they didn't want to move us since most time-share folks like us stay there.  We stayed in a one-bedroom so we could get an ocean view.  The room is sort of small and kind of out-dated.   The guy at the activity desk was very helpful.  The people at the front desk didn't seem to care much about us- my husband had a question and he had to wait until the lady at the front desk was done with her personal telephone call.  Very nice location though- right next to Dana Point.  We got to go to the ocean institute, Wild animal park, Carlsbad, San Clemente, Disneyland, and Newport.  Overall, not very impressive- I wouldn't stay there again.

The Riviera Beach and Spa Resort is a very nice, quaint little timeshare.  It has a very good location just off the I-5 and Pacific Coast Highway near Dana Point California.  Just a hop, skip and jump from the beach area and Dana Point shops.  1 negative was the Metrolink train system that was located just across the road from the resort. I was thinking after the first train went by, that would be it. On the contrary, it would be around 8-10 per evening.  No need to complain to management, because there is nothing they can do about it, so we just lived with it.  But, if you stay here and are a light sleeper, you may want to stay on the non-ocean view side.  As for the room itself, it was very roomy.  We had a 2-bedroom that we loved. Not exactly decorated for 2 toddlers running
